name: One Night Only
text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is equal to the number of [[Creature]] enemies in play.
[cultist] [tablet]: -2. If you fail, move once toward the nearest The Big Top location.
[elder_thing]: -1. -3 instead if this is a test against a [[Creature]] enemy.
back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X. X is equal to 1 + the number of [[Creature]] enemies in play.
[cultist] [tablet]: -3. Move once toward the nearest The Big Top location.
[elder_thing]: -2. -4 instead if this is a test against a [[Creature]] enemy.

name: The True Face
back_text: Another discordant trumpet rattles the air as a second elephantine horror bursts forth, trampling and goring with its twisted horns. Spawn the set-aside Disguised Monstrosity at any copy of The Big Top.

name: House of Horrors
back_text: The sparse clouds across the sky give the moon an appearance of flickering, but each time it does, the illusory magic strengthens like a surging tide. It's a struggle just to keep your wits about you. In player order, each investigator must either discard half the cards in their hand (rounded up) or search the chaos bag for a [moon] token and seal it on their investigator card.
back_name: By the Light of the Moon

name: Mesmeric Magic
back_text: Your droning perceptions erode your focus, and teetering on the edge of sleep, your feet slow to a standstill. You are transfixed, unable to think of anything but the spectacle of color and sound around you... and yet you stand. Your mind has battled the influence to a stalemate. For cloudy moments, you continue standing, until at the edge of your hearing, two rough voices call out. "Hey, this one's still standing!" "Not for long, they aren't." THUNK. Each investigator who has not resigned is defeated and suffers a physical or mental trauma (choose one).

name: Rats in a Cage
back_text: It becomes apparent from the crowd alone that the entrance is not simply hidden, but gone altogether. Whatever magic was used must have physically altered the circus wall, but that also means that like the monsters, the enchantment must have been applied directly to it. You scour the circus grounds, fending off the attackers and helping those you can, until at last you uncover the hidden source. A dark and smoky orb lies nestled in an out-of-the-way corner. Attach the set-aside Illusory Locus to Animal Cages. Add a [tablet] token to the chaos bag for the remainder of the campaign.

name: Rats in a Cage
back_text: It becomes apparent from the crowd alone that the entrance is not simply hidden, but gone altogether. Whatever magic was used must have physically altered the circus wall, but that also means that like the monsters, the enchantment must have been applied directly to it. You scour the circus grounds, fending off the attackers and helping those you can, until at last you uncover the hidden source. A dark and smoky orb lies nestled in an out-of-the-way corner. Attach the set-aside Illusory Locus to Carousel. Add a [tablet] token to the chaos bag for the remainder of the campaign.

name: Rats in a Cage
back_text: It becomes apparent from the crowd alone that the entrance is not simply hidden, but gone altogether. Whatever magic was used must have physically altered the circus wall, but that also means that like the monsters, the enchantment must have been applied directly to it. You scour the circus grounds, fending off the attackers and helping those you can, until at last you uncover the hidden source. A dark and smoky orb lies nestled in an out-of-the-way corner. Attach the set-aside Illusory Locus to Games Gallery. Add a [cultist] token to the chaos bag for the remainder of the campaign.

name: Rats in a Cage
back_text: It becomes apparent from the crowd alone that the entrance is not simply hidden, but gone altogether. Whatever magic was used must have physically altered the circus wall, but that also means that like the monsters, the enchantment must have been applied directly to it. You scour the circus grounds, fending off the attackers and helping those you can, until at last you uncover the hidden source. A dark and smoky orb lies nestled in an out-of-the-way corner. Attach the set-aside Illusory Locus to Performer Trailers. Add a [cultist] token to the chaos bag for the remainder of the campaign.

name: Smoke and Mirrors
text: [action] Choose and discard a card from your hand: Release a [moon] token sealed on your investigator card. (Limit once per round.) Objective - If there are 2[per_investigator] or more clues on Illusory Locus, advance.
back_text: You scrutinize the orb carefully, and notice that whenever clouds cover or uncover the moon, the illusions around you fluctuate. Though equally strong when the moon is visible or not, the spell must account for the changing visibility, like the alternating current of electricity. By applying direct pressure on the orb only when the moonlight is changing, you stress the magic, until at last the bauble cracks. The illusions around you waver, and at the north end of the circus grounds, the entryway reappears! Remove Illusory Locus from the game. Put the set-aside Circus Gates (Path to Freedom) into play.

name: Out and Away
text: [action] Choose and discard 2 cards from your hand: Release a [moon] token sealed on your investigator card. Objective - If each undefeated investigator has resigned, advance.
back_text: You waste little time in rushing through the circus gates to freedom, alongside as many of the other trapped spectators as you can find. If you never see the New Moon Circus again, it will be too soon. (â†’R2)

flavor:
The illusory power still tries to keep you
from escaping the clutches of the circus.
name: Circus Gates
text: [action] If there are no [moon] tokens sealed on your investigator card: Resign. You escape the illusion isolating the circus.
back_flavor:
It almost looks too good to be true,
but this is no illusion.

name: Illusory Locus
text: [action]: Reveal 4 random tokens from the chaos bag. If you reveal a [bless] or [curse] token, ignore it and reveal another token. Investigators at your location may spend any amount of clues as a group to reveal 4 additional tokens for each clue spent. For each [moon] token revealed, add 1 clue to Illusory Locus from the token bank. Any investigator at the attached location may activate this ability.

name: Disguised Monstrosity
text: Hunter. Massive. If Disguised Monstrosity's location is revealed and there are no clues on it, Disguised Monstrosity gets -1 fight and each successful attack against it deals +1 damage. Forced - After Disguised Monstrosity moves to a revealed location with no clues on it: Exhaust it.

flavor:
The thing that was masquerading as a circus lion
has now shown its true face.
name: Grotesque Lion
text:
Hunter.
Grotesque Lion gets +1 fight and -1 evade during the round that it entered play.

name: Maddening Spectacle
text: Revelation - Put Maddening Spectacle into play in your threat area. You get -1 skill value to your highest skill. (If 2 or more skills would be your highest skill, choose one of them when this card enters play). [action]: Test any other skill (3). If you succeed, discard Maddening Spectacle.

flavor: He definitely wasn't hired for his personality.
name: New Moon Drudge
text:
Hunter.
While New Moon Drudge is ready, investigators at its location cannot activate abilities printed on scenario cards.

name: The Primrose Path
text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is equal to the number of locations connected to Circus Encampment.
[cultist]: -3. If there are no [moon] tokens sealed on your investigator card, lose an action.
[tablet]: -2. If there are 1 or more [moon] tokens sealed on your investigator card, lose an action.
[elder_thing]: -2. If a [moon] token was revealed during this test, it automatically fails instead.
back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X. X is equal to 1 + the number of locations connected to Circus Encampment.
[cultist]: -4. If there are no [moon] tokens sealed on your investigator card, lose an action.
[tablet]: -3. If there are 1 or more [moon] tokens sealed on your investigator card, lose an action.
[elder_thing]: -4. If a [moon] token was revealed during this test, it automatically fails instead.

name: Savage Nature
text: Adjacent copies of Moonlit Forest are connected to each other.
back_text: Amid your struggles to navigate the woods, you keep an eye frequently trained on the lights of the distant circus camp. Looking this time however, the silhouette of a lone figure briefly obscures it before vanishing from view. Your meddling with the illusions has not gone unnoticed. Spawn the set-aside New Moon Illusionist at Circus Encampment.

name: Blood Moon
text: Adjacent copies of Moonlit Forest are connected to each other.
back_text: Another cry cracks through the air, but one far less familiar than before. Truly monstrous being shamble through the foliage, snapping trees and crumpling terrain as they gallop toward you. Mouths, tentacles and hooves strike at you as you flee for your life desperately into the forest. Each investigator is defeated and suffers a physical or mental trauma (choose one).

name: Forest of Illusion
text: [fast] If you are at a [[Woods]] location, investigators spend 1[per_investigator] clues as a group: Treat your location's printed text box as if it were (except for [[Traits]] and Victory X) for the remainder of the game. (Place a horror on the location as a reminder.) Objective - If each undefeated investigator is at Circus Encampment, you may advance.
back_text: By learning and gradually unworking the illusions spread throughout the forest, you finally approach the outskirts of the circus camp. No alarm appears to have been raised, so you proceed with stifled breaths and careful movements. (â†’R2)

flavor: Don't let the path out of your sight.
name: Forest Passage
text: [fast] Place 1[per_investigator] of your clues on Forest Passage: Look at the revealed side of any copy of Moonlit Forest.
back_flavor:
A single beaten path winds through the trees,
sometimes breaking off for yards at a time.

flavor:
This house is too old and derelict to have been set up
by the circus, but it still exudes an air of malice.
name: Remote Cabin
text:
Remote Cabin is connected to the three rightmost copies of Moonlit Forest, and vice versa.
As an additional cost to move from Remote Cabin to a non-[[Woods]] location, place 1 doom on a card you control.
back_flavor:
An abandoned house lies nestled in the nearby woods,
but protected from approach by the magic around it.
back_text:
Remote Cabin is connected to the three rightmost copies of Moonlit Forest, and vice versa.
Investigators cannot enter Remote Cabin while there is fewer than 2 damage on it.

flavor:
It is impractical, even risky, to navigate from
this cliffside anywhere but back into the forest.
name: Woodland Overlook
text:
Woodland Overlook is connected to the three leftmost copies of Moonlit Forest, and vice versa.
As an additional cost to move from Woodland Overlook to a non-[[Woods]] location, discard a non-weakness asset you control.
back_flavor: A single cliff rises above the treeline. It would be a great vantage point if you can find a way up to it.
back_text:
Woodland Overlook is connected to the three leftmost copies of Moonlit Forest, and vice versa.
Investigators cannot enter Woodland Overlook while there is fewer than 2 damage on it.

flavor: At last, the path is unobstructed.
name: Circus Encampment
text: [reaction] When you end your turn at Circus Encampment: Release any amount of [moon] tokens sealed on your investigator card.
back_flavor:
The distant lights of the circus tents are clearly visible,
so why does every route lead away from it?
back_text: Investigators cannot enter Circus Encampment while there are fewer than 5 locations connected to it.

name: Moonlit Forest
text: Forced - After you reveal this location: Place 1 damage on Remote Cabin. As an additional cost to move from this location to any other [[Woods]] location, search the encounter deck and discard pile for an enemy and spawn it engaged with you. (It does not make attacks of opportunity.) Shuffle the encounter deck if it was searched.
back_flavor: Blanched by the moonlight, the details of each tree blend together and give opportunities to lurking threats.

name: Moonlit Forest
text: Forced - After you reveal this location: Place 1 damage on Remote Cabin. As an additional cost to move from this location to any other [[Woods]] location, search the encounter deck and discard pile for a [[Hex]] treachery and draw it. Shuffle the encounter deck if it was searched.
back_flavor: Blanched by the moonlight, the details of each tree blend together and give opportunities to lurking threats.

name: Moonlit Forest
text: Forced - After you reveal this location: Place 1 damage on Woodland Overlook. As an additional cost to move from this location to any other [[Woods]] location, choose and discard a card from your hand and lose a resource.
back_flavor: Blanched by the moonlight, the details of each tree blend together and give opportunities to lurking threats.

name: Moonlit Forest
text: Forced - After you reveal this location: Place 1 damage on Woodland Overlook. As an additional cost to move from this location to any other [[Woods]] location, search the token bag for a [moon] token and seal it on your investigator card.
back_flavor: Blanched by the moonlight, the details of each tree blend together and give opportunities to lurking threats.

flavor: A particularly strong enchantment lingers in the grove.
name: Moonlit Forest
text:
This location loses its moon connection symbol.
You cannot activate the [fast] ability on the act at this location while there are 1 or more clues on this location.
back_flavor: Blanched by the moonlight, the details of each tree blend together and give opportunities to lurking threats.

flavor: You dare not follow the lights in this marshy ground.
name: Moonlit Forest
text:
This location loses its moon connection symbol.
As an additional cost to activate the [fast] ability on the act at this location, search the chaos bag for a [moon] token and seal it on your investigator card.
back_flavor: Blanched by the moonlight, the details of each tree blend together and give opportunities to lurking threats.

flavor: As unsettling as the full moon is, worse still is its absence.
name: Moonlit Forest
text: This location and each adjacent copy of Moonlit Forest gain "Forced - After you end your turn at this location, if there are no [moon] tokens sealed on your investigator card: Take 1 horror."
back_flavor: Blanched by the moonlight, the details of each tree blend together and give opportunities to lurking threats.

flavor: Thick fog spills over from this low valley into nearby regions.
name: Moonlit Forest
text: This location gets +2 shroud value. Each adjacent copy of Moonlit Forest gets +1 shroud value.
back_flavor: Blanched by the moonlight, the details of each tree blend together and give opportunities to lurking threats.

flavor: All roads lead to the middle of nowhere.
name: Moonlit Forest
text: Forced - When an investigator at an adjacent copy of Moonlit Forest moves to a location other than this location: That investigator discards a card from their hand at random.
back_flavor: Blanched by the moonlight, the details of each tree blend together and give opportunities to lurking threats.

flavor: An air of decay permeates the surrounding area.
name: Moonlit Forest
text: Each [moon] token revealed at this location and each adjacent copy of Moonlit Forest gains "Take 1 damage."
back_flavor: Blanched by the moonlight, the details of each tree blend together and give opportunities to lurking threats.

name: New Moon Illusionist
text:
Hunter. Aloof.
The first [[Hex]] treachery drawn each round by each investigator at New Moon Illusionist's location and each connecting [[Woods]] location gains surge.
While New Moon Illusionist is exhausted, it loses aloof.

flavor: It's not a tiger, so what the hell is it?
name: Circus Predator
text: Hunter. Spawn - Any [[Woods]] location. Forced - After Circus Predator moves from a [[Woods]] location to another [[Woods]] location: It gets +1 horror until the end of the round.

name: Feral Impulses
text: Revelation - Put Feral Impulses into play next to the agenda deck. Forced - When the mythos phase begins: Each investigator with 1 or more [moon] tokens sealed on their investigator card chooses and discards an asset they control. Discard Feral Impulses. (Max once per round.)

flavor: "Wait, maybe it was the other way."
name: Moonlight Illusion
text: Revelation - Test [willpower] or [agility] (3). This test gets +1 difficulty for each [moon] token sealed on investigator cards at your location. If you fail, place 1 of your clues on your location and move to a connecting [[Woods]] location.

flavor: An actual bear would be welcome at this point.
name: Ursine Brute
text: Hunter. Spawn - Any [[Woods]] location. Forced - After Ursine Brute takes 1 or more damage: Ready it.

name: Harm's Way
text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is equal to half the number of [[Bystander]] cards in the victory display (rounded up).
[cultist]: -3. If you have not moved this round, choose and discard a card from your hand or lose a resource (choose one).
[tablet]: -3. If you have moved this round, choose and discard a card from your hand or lose a resource (choose one).
[elder_thing]: -2. If you fail, reveal a fury token.
back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X. X is equal to 1 + half the number of [[Bystander]] cards in the victory display (rounded up).
[cultist]: -4. If you have not moved this round, choose and discard a card from your hand or lose a resource (choose one).
[tablet]: -4. If you have moved this round, choose and discard a card from your hand or lose a resource (choose one).
[elder_thing]: -4. If you fail, reveal a fury token.

name: The Circus Sleeps
text: Forced - After doom is placed on this agenda, if there is an even number of doom on the agenda: Reveal a fury token.
back_text: The colossal monsters shift again, snapping at anything that strays close enough, including each other. The more active they become, the greater the risks will grow. Add a [moon] token to the fury bag.

name: Treading on Eggshells
text: Forced - After doom is placed on this agenda, if there is an even number of doom on the agenda: Reveal a fury token.
back_text: Another baying howl - warped, but like a wolf's - rattles across the camp, and the writhing forms of the monsters grow more restless. Add a [moon] token to the fury bag.

name: Sleep When You're Dead
text: Forced - After doom is placed on this agenda, if there is an even number of doom on the agenda: Reveal a fury token.
back_text: An ominous feeling rises around the camp, and you glance with dread off into the woods. Sylvester Blake has returned, walking slowly but with a quiet fury. The ringmaster's very appearance has darkened, leaving him little more than a silhouette against the moonlight. A voice calls out, but it's not the voice you heard at his departure. It is raw and guttural, spouting words not of this earth. The towering monsters rise at the first utterance, descending on you with terrifying speed. You flee for your life back into the woods, weathering blows and unnatural cries. Each investigator who has not resigned is defeated and suffers a physical or mental trauma (choose one).

name: Escape Act (v.I)
text: Objective - The investigators may advance at any time. (Be ready to make your escape!)
back_text: With time pressing, you have to make a clean getaway while you're still healthy and sane enough to do so. From the looks of it, your rapid success at the circus earlier gave Blake some idea of your capabilities. Remove each copy of Kidnapped Citizen in play from the game (including ones flipped to their story card sides). Reveal a fury token. If you reveal a [moon] token, ignore it and reveal another token. Instead of resolving the effects on The Dark Young Stir... story card, put Camp Outskirts (Guarded Closely) into play adjacent to a [[Camp]] location corresponding to the direction of the revealed token. (ex. the [skull] token would place the location above the top copy of Crowded Row). Return each fury token to the fury bag.

name: Escape Act (v.II)
text: Objective - The investigators may advance at any time. (Be ready to make your escape!)
back_text: With time pressing, you have to make a clean getaway while you're still healthy and sane enough to do so. From the looks of it, Blake is feeling confident about his superiority and hasn't been especially careful. Remove each copy of Kidnapped Citizen in play from the game (including ones flipped to their story card sides). Reveal a fury token. If you reveal a [moon] token, ignore it and reveal another token. Instead of resolving the effects on The Dark Young Stir... story card, put Camp Outskirts (Quiet, For Now) into play adjacent to a [[Camp]] location corresponding to the direction of the revealed token. (ex. the [skull] token would place the location above the top copy of Crowded Row). Return each fury token to the fury bag.

name: Overdue Departure
text: [reaction] After you evade or defeat an enemy at Camp Outskirts: Discover a clue from Camp Outskirts. Objective - If each undefeated investigator is at Camp Outskirts and there are no clues on it, advance.
back_text: With all safeguards removed, you hurriedly usher the freed citizens ahead of you, instructing them to make straight north toward the dim lights of Arkham. (â†’R2)

flavor:
You can't understand most of the eldritch books,
but there may be some useful information here regardless.
name: Ringmaster's Trailer
text: [action]: Test [willpower] or [intellect] (3) to search through Blake's occult library. If you succeed, draw 2 cards. If you fail, take 1 horror. (Limit once per round.)
back_flavor:
Ironically, it's the safest place in
the circus encampment right now.

flavor: Careful not to be too obvious about your investigations.
name: Crowded Row
text: Forced - After you succeed at investigating this location by 3 or more: Place 1 doom on the nearest non-[[Elite]] enemy.
back_flavor:
The resting performers cluster together here,
making movement a tricky prospect.

flavor: Here in the heart of the enemy, they're at their strongest.
name: Crowded Row
text: Forced - After a non-[[Elite]] enemy enters this location: It gets +1 fight and +1 evade until the end of the round.
back_flavor:
The resting performers cluster together here,
making movement a tricky prospect.

flavor: The further you delve, the more promising the results.
name: Crowded Row
text: [reaction] When you initiate an investigation attempt at this location: Crowded Row gets +3 shroud value for this attempt. If you succeed, discover 1 additional clue. (Limit once per round.)
back_flavor:
The resting performers cluster together here,
making movement a tricky prospect.

flavor: Give them the slip, and they'll lead you right to the captives.
name: Crowded Row
text: [reaction] After you evade an enemy at this location: Take an investigate action. (Limit once per round.)
back_flavor:
The resting performers cluster together here,
making movement a tricky prospect.

flavor: They can't hunt you down if they can't find you.
name: Secluded Tent
text: [action] Place 1 of your clues on Secluded Tent: Non-[[Elite]] enemies at other locations cannot target you while resolving the hunter keyword until the end of the round. (Limit once per round.)
back_flavor:
These tents may be more isolated and quiet,
but there may also be more danger lurking within.

flavor:
With a little cunning, you may evade
the enormous monsters looming nearby.
name: Secluded Tent
text: [action] Place 1 of your clues on Secluded Tent: Choose an investigator at this location. They cannot be attacked by Towering Dark Young enemies until the start of the next investigation phase.
back_flavor:
These tents may be more isolated and quiet,
but there may also be more danger lurking within.

flavor:
The moon may lend you a great advantage
in the darkened tents.
name: Secluded Tent
text: [reaction] When you reveal a [moon] token during a skill test at this location: This test automatically succeeds.
back_flavor:
These tents may be more isolated and quiet,
but there may also be more danger lurking within.

flavor:
You must take advantage of the moonlight
to light your way around these shadowed grounds.
name: Secluded Tent
text: [reaction] After a [moon] token is released at this location: This location gets -2 shroud value until the end of the next round. (Max once per round.)
back_flavor:
These tents may be more isolated and quiet,
but there may also be more danger lurking within.

flavor: The circus took every precaution here.
name: Camp Outskirts
text:
Camp Outskirts is connected to the adjacent [[Camp]] location, and vice versa.
Camp Outskirts is considered to be at the same position as the adjacent [[Camp]] location while resolving fury tokens.
back_flavor: A few short hours ago, you had trouble finding your way in. Now, you have the opposite problem.
back_text: Camp Outskirts is connected to the adjacent [[Camp]] location, and vice versa.

flavor: The circus is underestimating you, perhaps.
name: Camp Outskirts
text:
Camp Outskirts is connected to the adjacent [[Camp]] location, and vice versa.
Camp Outskirts is considered to be at the same position as the adjacent [[Camp]] location while resolving fury tokens.
back_flavor: A few short hours ago, you had trouble finding your way in. Now, you have the opposite problem.
back_text: Camp Outskirts is connected to the adjacent [[Camp]] location, and vice versa.

name: The Dark Young Stir...
text: Forced - When a card instructs you to reveal a fury token, the active investigator reveals a random token from the fury bag. Then, depending on the token drawn, each Towering Dark Young makes an immediate attack against each investigator at the location... [skull] - ...directly above them. [cultist] - ...directly below them. [tablet] - ...directly to the left of them. [elder_thing] - ...directly to the right of them. [moon] - Immediately reveal two additional fury tokens. After resolving this effect, return each fury token to the fury bag.

name: Hidden in Plain Sight
text: At first, it seems like this prisoner is unguarded, but the shimmer of illusory magic sparks up as you approach. You won't be able to rescue them until you can determine a way past the illusion. [action]: Test [willpower] or [intellect] (3). This test gets +1[per_investigator] difficulty. When you initiate this test, investigators at your location may spend 1[per_investigator] clues as a group to automatically succeed. If you succeed, flip this card and move it to the victory display. If you fail, take 1 horror.

flavor:
More unfortunate circus goers are being held captive in this part of the camp. Can you find your way
safely to them?
name: Kidnapped Citizen
text: At first, it seems like this prisoner is unguarded, but the shimmer of illusory magic sparks up as you approach. You won't be able to rescue them until you can determine a way past the illusion. [action]: Test [willpower] or [intellect] (3). This test gets +1[per_investigator] difficulty. When you initiate this test, investigators at your location may spend 1[per_investigator] clues as a group to automatically succeed. If you succeed, flip this card and move it to the victory display. If you fail, take 1 horror. [fast] Investigators at this location spend 1[per_investigator] clues as a group: Flip Kidnapped Citizen.

name: Under Lock and Key
text: The circus has taken no chances, and has imprisoned this captive in an iron cage on top of their restraints. The lock for the cage is thankfully in poor condition, and can possibly be broken or jimmied open. [action]: Test [combat] or [agility] (3). This test gets +1[per_investigator] difficulty. When you initiate this test, investigators at your location may spend 1[per_investigator] clues as a group to automatically succeed. If you succeed, flip this card and move it to the victory display. If you fail, take 1 damage.

flavor:
More unfortunate circus goers are being held captive in this part of the camp. Can you find your way
safely to them?
name: Kidnapped Citizen
text: The circus has taken no chances, and has imprisoned this captive in an iron cage on top of their restraints. The lock for the cage is thankfully in poor condition, and can possibly be broken or jimmied open. [action]: Test [combat] or [agility] (3). This test gets +1[per_investigator] difficulty. When you initiate this test, investigators at your location may spend 1[per_investigator] clues as a group to automatically succeed. If you succeed, flip this card and move it to the victory display. If you fail, take 1 damage. [fast] Investigators at this location spend 1[per_investigator] clues as a group: Flip Kidnapped Citizen.

name: Cautious Jailers
text: While most of the camp sleeps, a small group stands watch over this captive. Taking on this many at once would be sure to rouse the whole camp, but maybe there's a way to distract them - perhaps a big way. [reaction] After a Towering Dark Young attacks an investigator at this location (even if that attack was canceled): Place 1 resource on this card. [fast] Spend 1 clue: Place 1 resource on this card. Forced - If there are 1[per_investigator] or more resources on this card: Flip it and move it to the victory display.

flavor:
More unfortunate circus goers are being held captive in this part of the camp. Can you find your way
safely to them?
name: Kidnapped Citizen
text: While most of the camp sleeps, a small group stands watch over this captive. Taking on this many at once would be sure to rouse the whole camp, but maybe there's a way to distract them - perhaps a big way. [reaction] After a Towering Dark Young attacks an investigator at this location (even if that attack was canceled): Place 1 resource on this card. [fast] Spend 1 clue: Place 1 resource on this card. Forced - If there are 1[per_investigator] or more resources on this card: Flip it and move it to the victory display. [fast] Investigators at this location spend 1[per_investigator] clues as a group: Flip Kidnapped Citizen.

name: Deep in the Dark
text: You've managed to locate one captive, but they're being kept inside a hovel with barely any light. You'll have to work carefully to free them, or trust that the bright moonlight will give you enough vision. [action] Investigators at this location spend 1[per_investigator] clues as a group: Flip this card and move it to the victory display. Reduce the amount of clues required for this action by 1 for each [moon] token sealed on a player card at this location.

flavor:
More unfortunate circus goers are being held captive in this part of the camp. Can you find your way
safely to them?
name: Kidnapped Citizen
text: You've managed to locate one captive, but they're being kept inside a hovel with barely any light. You'll have to work carefully to free them, or trust that the bright moonlight will give you enough vision. [action] Investigators at this location spend 1[per_investigator] clues as a group: Flip this card and move it to the victory display. Reduce the amount of clues required for this action by 1 for each [moon] token sealed on a player card at this location. [fast] Investigators at this location spend 1[per_investigator] clues as a group: Flip Kidnapped Citizen.

name: Clapped in Irons
text: This captive has been locked securely in chains that have no key whatsoever. There may be a clever way to break the shackles, but you can wrest the chains from their anchors if need be. [action] Investigators at this location spend 1[per_investigator] clues as a group: Flip this card and move it to the victory display. Investigators at this location may take any amount of damage as a group to reduce the amount of clues required for this action by 1 for each damage taken.

flavor:
More unfortunate circus goers are being held captive in this part of the camp. Can you find your way
safely to them?
name: Kidnapped Citizen
text: This captive has been locked securely in chains that have no key whatsoever. There may be a clever way to break the shackles, but you can wrest the chains from their anchors if need be. [action] Investigators at this location spend 1[per_investigator] clues as a group: Flip this card and move it to the victory display. Investigators at this location may take any amount of damage as a group to reduce the amount of clues required for this action by 1 for each damage taken. [fast] Investigators at this location spend 1[per_investigator] clues as a group: Flip Kidnapped Citizen.

name: Hypnotic State
text: Already bound, this captive is still being kept in a mesmeric trance to ensure they can't escape. You can hardly drag them around without breaking the spell, but can you do that without risking your own mind? [action] Investigators at this location spend 1[per_investigator] clues as a group: Flip this card and move it to the victory display. Investigators at this location may take any amount of horror as a group to reduce the amount of clues required for this action by 1 for each horror taken.

flavor:
More unfortunate circus goers are being held captive in this part of the camp. Can you find your way
safely to them?
name: Kidnapped Citizen
text: Already bound, this captive is still being kept in a mesmeric trance to ensure they can't escape. You can hardly drag them around without breaking the spell, but can you do that without risking your own mind? [action] Investigators at this location spend 1[per_investigator] clues as a group: Flip this card and move it to the victory display. Investigators at this location may take any amount of horror as a group to reduce the amount of clues required for this action by 1 for each horror taken. [fast] Investigators at this location spend 1[per_investigator] clues as a group: Flip Kidnapped Citizen.

flavor:
The thing lashes out wildly,
not even aiming at anything nearby.
name: Towering Dark Young
text:
Massive.
[reaction] When Towering Dark Young would attack you: Test [agility] (0). For each point you succeed by, reduce the damage dealt by this attack by 1.

flavor:
Focused on the blood-red moon,
the thing howls balefully into the night.
name: Towering Dark Young
text:
Massive.
[reaction] When Towering Dark Young would attack you: Test [willpower] (0). For each point you succeed by, reduce the horror dealt by this attack by 1.

flavor:
This creature is highly skittish,
and will latch onto the first thing it sees.
name: Towering Dark Young
text:
Massive.
[reaction] When Towering Dark Young would attack you, choose and discard a non-weakness asset from your hand or your play area: Cancel this attack.

flavor:
This abomination is highly aggressive,
but can still be beaten back.
name: Towering Dark Young
text:
Massive.
[reaction] When Towering Dark Young would attack you: Make an attack against Towering Dark Young as if it were at your location. If you succeed, instead of resolving the effects of the successful attack, cancel Towering Dark Young's attack.

flavor:
This abomination has razor-honed sense,
but can still be fooled.
name: Towering Dark Young
text:
Massive.
[reaction] When Towering Dark Young would attack you: Make an investigation attempt. If you succeed, instead of resolving the effects of the successful investigation, cancel Towering Dark Young's attack.

name: Close Watch
text: Revelation - Put Close Watch into play next to the agenda deck. Forced - When you would take an action to move from a location, you must (choose one): - Spend 1 additional action. - After completing this action, discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until an enemy is discarded. Spawn that enemy at your location. Forced - At the end of the round, discard Close Watch.

name: Keep Quiet
text: Revelation - Put Keep Quiet into play in your threat area. Forced - After you deal 1 or more damage to an enemy or discover 1 or more clues: Place 1 doom on the nearest non-[[Elite]] enemy. [reaction] After an enemy at your location is evaded: Discard Keep Quiet.

name: Sacrificial Shepherd
text: Spawn - Any location (with a [[Bystander]] asset or story card, if possible). While Sacrificial Shepherd is ready, investigators cannot activate abilities on [[Bystander]] assets or story cards at Sacrificial Shepherd's location. If there are no [[Bystander]] assets or story cards at Sacrificial Shepherd's location, it gains hunter and gets +1 evade and +1 damage.

flavor:
The massive dark young lash out violently
as they await feeding by their circus handlers.
name: Violent Thrashing
text: Revelation - Reveal a fury token.

name: All Points West
text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is equal to half the doom in play (rounded up).
[cultist]: -1. If you fail, place 1 doom on Locomotive Engine.
[tablet]: -1. If you fail, draw the topmost [[Hazard]] treachery in the encounter discard pile.
[elder_thing]: -2. If you fail, ready a [[Dark Young]] enemy in play.
back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X. X is equal to 1 + half the doom in play (rounded up).
[cultist]: -2. Place 1 doom on Locomotive Engine.
[tablet]: -2. Draw the topmost [[Hazard]] treachery in the encounter discard pile.
[elder_thing]: -2. Ready a [[Dark Young]] enemy in play.

name: Schedule to Keep
text: This agenda cannot advance by reaching a doom threshold. Forced - When an investigator would be defeated, if there are 1 or more undefeated investigators: Advance this agenda. (The scenario will not end.)
back_text: If this agenda advanced due to an investigator defeat: Overwhelmed, you fall to the floor of the train, unconscious. Do not remove doom from this agenda. The defeated investigator moves their investigator mini-card beneath the agenda. Do not remove cards controlled by that investigator from play. The next time the act advances, each defeated investigator heals damage and horror until they have at least 3 remaining health and sanity. Those investigators are no longer defeated, but still suffer the trauma from their defeat (and are killed or driven insane if their trauma is high enough). Move their investigator minicards to Caboose. Flip this agenda back to its 'a' side. Otherwise: Carrie shouts for you to brace for a crash as the attackers force the train to jump the tracks, sending it grinding off beside the rails. Each investigator is defeated and suffers a physical or mental trauma (choose one).

name: Through the Forests (v.I)
text: Objective - At the end of the round, if investigators as a group possess the requisite number of clues, they may advance. (Enemies still in play will delay you!)
back_text: The train eases to a halt in the yards outside Central Station, marking the end of this leg of the journey. Ralph and Carrie deliver and take on new cargo to keep their cover, leaving you free for the moment. For each enemy in play, place 1 doom on the agenda. Check the amount of doom in play. If there is... - ...6 or fewer doom in play, read Not in This Town under Scenario Interlude: Now Arriving in the Campaign Guide. - ...7 or more doom in play, read Wrong Territory under Scenario Interlude: Now Arriving in the Campaign Guide. Remove all doom from play. Discard each enemy. Replace each [[Freight Car]] and [[Special Car]] location with another random set-aside [[Freight Car]] and [[Special Car]] location. Move each replaced location with Victory X and no clues to the victory display. Fully replenish the clues on Locomotive Engine and Caboose. Put a random set-aside [[Dark Young]] enemy into play at Caboose.

name: Through the Forests (v.II)
text: Objective - At the end of the round, if investigators as a group possess the requisite number of clues, they may advance. (Enemies still in play will delay you!)
back_text: The train eases to a halt in the yards outside Central Station, marking the end of this leg of the journey. Ralph and Carrie deliver and take on new cargo to keep their cover, leaving you free for the moment. For each enemy in play, place 1 doom on the agenda. Check the amount of doom in play. If there is... - ...6 or fewer doom in play, read Stomping Ground under Scenario Interlude: Now Arriving in the Campaign Guide. - ...7 or more doom in play, read Fool's Errand under Scenario Interlude: Now Arriving in the Campaign Guide. Remove all doom from play. Discard each enemy. Replace each [[Freight Car]] and [[Special Car]] location with another random set-aside [[Freight Car]] and [[Special Car]] location. Move each replaced location with Victory X and no clues to the victory display. Fully replenish the clues on Locomotive Engine and Caboose. Put a random set-aside [[Dark Young]] enemy into play at Caboose.

name: No Free Rides
text: Objective - At the end of the round, if there are no [[Dark Young]] enemies in play, you may advance.
back_text: With the horrible creature left screaming on the tracks behind you, you complete the short journey to Union Station. For each enemy in play, place 1 doom on the agenda. Check the amount of doom in play. If there is... - ...6 or fewer doom in play, read Nature of the Beast under Scenario Interlude: Now Arriving in the Campaign Guide. - ...7 or more doom in play, read Skeletons in the Closet under Scenario Interlude: Now Arriving in the Campaign Guide. Remove all doom from play. Discard each enemy. Replace each [[Freight Car]] and [[Special Car]] location with another random set-aside [[Freight Car]] and [[Special Car]] location. Move each replaced location with Victory X and no clues to the victory display. Fully replenish the clues on Locomotive Engine and Caboose. Put a random set-aside [[Dark Young]] enemy into play at Locomotive Engine.

name: Engine Trouble
text: Objective - At the end of the round, if there are no [[Dark Young]] enemies in play, you may advance.
back_text: Another close call, but the monster was successfully repelled, and the welcome arch of Union Station looms ahead. For each enemy in play, place 1 doom on the agenda. Check the amount of doom in play. If there is... - ...6 or fewer doom in play, read Behind the Curtain under Scenario Interlude: Now Arriving in the Campaign Guide. - ...7 or more doom in play, read Humane Treatment under Scenario Interlude: Now Arriving in the Campaign Guide. Remove all doom from play. Discard each enemy. Replace each [[Freight Car]] and [[Special Car]] location with another random set-aside [[Freight Car]] and [[Special Car]] location. Move each replaced location with Victory X and no clues to the victory display. Fully replenish the clues on Locomotive Engine and Caboose. Put each set-aside [[Circus Train]] location into play. Put a random set-aside [[Dark Young]] enemy into play at Exotic Animal Car.

name: The Great Train Horror
text: Forced - At the end of the round, if there is 9 or more doom in play: Immediately advance to agenda 1b. Objective - If there is 4[per_investigator] or more damage on Circus Engine, you may advance.
back_text: With the brakes of the circus train locked and its controls damaged, you leap back onto your own train. Ralph and Carrie give full steam ahead, speeding you onward to the coast. Check the amount of doom in play. If there is... - ...6 or fewer doom in play, (â†’R3). - ...7 or more doom in play, (â†’R4).

flavor:
The comforts of the caboose are the closest thing you have
to a home away from home.
name: Caboose
text:
[action] If there are no enemies at Caboose:
Heal 1 damage. (Limit once per round.)

flavor:
The front of the train is the best position
to see what's coming down the line.
name: Locomotive Engine
text: [action]: Look at the top 4 cards of the encounter deck. Put them back on top of the deck in the same order. (Group limit once per round.)

flavor: The calm and enclosed car makes respite a little easier.
name: Boxcar
text: [reaction] After you play an event that targets an investigator: Draw a card. (Limit once per round.)

flavor:
Being completely exposed on the moving train
does little to calm your nerves.
name: Flatcar
text: Forced - After you end your turn at Flatcar, if there are 1 or more clues on it: Choose and discard a card from your hand.

flavor:
You may be able to exploit the sloped cars
against anything attacking you.
name: Gondola Car
text: [reaction] After you play an event that targets an enemy: Draw a card. (Limit once per round.)

flavor:
The cattle being transported are understandably skittish.
You both might benefit from calming them down a little.
name: Stock Car
text: [action]: You pet the cows. Heal 1 horror. (Limit once per round.)

flavor:
The cylindrical car makes it difficult
to find footing while the train is moving.
name: Tank Car
text: Forced - After you end your turn at Tank Car, if there are 1 or more clues on it: Lose 1 resource.

flavor:
Some of the coal here is of noticeably higher quality.
Think they'll miss a couple chunks?
name: Coal Hopper Car
text: While there are no clues on Coal Hopper Car, treat the agenda as if there were 1 fewer total doom on it.

flavor:
If you can learn the controls,
this mechanical crane might prove a useful tool.
name: Crane Car
text: [action] If there are no clues on Crane Car: Disengage and move an investigator or non-[[Elite]] enemy from any location directly to Crane Car. (Group limit once per round.)

flavor:
Something about a mail room lends itself
toward organizing the mind.
name: Mail Car
text: [reaction] After you draw a card during the upkeep phase, if there are no clues on Mail Car: Draw an additional card. (Limit once per round.)

flavor: Perfectly preserved for when you want it fresh.
name: Refrigerator Car
text: While there are no clues on Refrigerator Car, the first asset played at Refrigerator Car by each investigator each round gets -1 cost.

flavor:
While meant to protect the car's contents,
the extra protection could be of use to you as well.
name: Reinforced Car
text: [reaction] When an enemy attacks you, if there are no clues on Reinforced Car: Reduce the damage or horror dealt by that attack by 1 (choose one).

flavor: You've got to put this engine out of commission.
name: Circus Engine
text:
[action] Spend 1-3 clues: Place an equal amount of damage on Circus Engine.
[action]: Take a fight action against Circus Engine's shroud value. If you succeed, instead of dealing damage, place 1 damage on Circus Engine (2 damage instead if this attack would deal 3 or more damage).
back_flavor:
The brightly-painted engine disguises
the horrors in tow.

flavor: Nothing like a caged beast to increase the danger.
name: Exotic Animal Car
text: While fighting or evading [[Monster]] enemies at Exotic Animal Car, treat each [skull] token revealed as if it were a [auto_fail] token instead.
back_flavor:
A grotesque abomination rises through
the broken roof of this car, roaring savagely.

flavor: Invasion of privacy is the least of your worries right now.
name: Performers' Car
text: Performers' Car gets +1 shroud value for each enemy at this location.
back_flavor: The performer trailers have been strapped down to flatbeds, converting them into coaches of a sort.

name: Carrie Dykstra
text:
[fast] Exhaust Carrie Dykstra: Move her to a connecting [[Train]] location. Investigators at any location may trigger this ability.
Carrie Dykstra's location gains "[reaction] After you enter this location: Test [combat] or [agility] (2). If you succeed, move to a connecting location. (Limit once per round.)"

name: Ralph Dykstra
text: [fast] If Ralph Dykstra is ready, investigators at Locomotive Engine place 1[per_investigator] clues on Locomotive Engine as a group: Remove 1 doom from any card in play. Any investigator at Locomotive Engine may trigger this ability. (Group limit once per round.)

name: Looming Goatspawn
text: Massive. Alert. Forced - If Looming Goatspawn would be defeated by damage from an investigator with 1 or more [moon] tokens sealed on their investigator card: Cancel that damage. [reaction] After 1 or more damage is dealt to Looming Goatspawn, spend 1-3 clues as a group: Deal 1 additional damage to Looming Goatspawn for each clue spent.

name: Rampaging Goatspawn
text: Massive. Forced - After you attack Rampaging Goatspawn: For each [moon] token sealed on your investigator card, discard a card from your hand at random. [reaction] After 1 or more damage is dealt to Rampaging Goatspawn, spend 1-3 clues as a group: Deal 1 additional damage to Rampaging Goatspawn for each clue spent.

name: Ravenous Goatspawn
text: Massive. Retaliate. Alert. Forced - After Ravenous Goatspawn attacks you, if there are 1 or more [moon] tokens sealed on your investigator card: Lose 2 resources. [reaction] After 1 or more damage is dealt to Ravenous Goatspawn, spend 1-3 clues as a group: Deal 1 additional damage to Ravenous Goatspawn for each clue spent.

name: Writhing Goatspawn
text: Massive. Retaliate. Forced - After you enter Writhing Goatspawn's location, if Writhing Goatspawn is ready and there are 1 or more [moon] tokens sealed on your investigator card: Writhing Goatspawn attacks you. [reaction] After 1 or more damage is dealt to Writhing Goatspawn, spend 1-3 clues as a group: Deal 1 additional damage to Writhing Goatspawn for each clue spent.

flavor:
Connected now only by emergency cables,
the two cars now ride a dangerous distance apart.
name: Broken Couplings
text: Peril. Revelation - Place Broken Couplings between two [[Train]] locations without a copy between them. Investigators cannot move between these two locations. [action] Spend 2 resources: Discard Broken Couplings. Investigators at either location may activate this ability.

name: Focused Sabotage
text: Revelation - Put Focused Sabotage into play next to the agenda deck. Forced - After doom is placed on an enemy: It makes an immediate attack against the nearest investigator. (Max once per enemy per phase.) Forced - After an enemy with 1 or more doom on it is evaded: Discard a copy of Focused Sabotage. (Max once per enemy).

name: New Moon Stiltwalker
text: Spawn - Any location (without investigators, if possible). Hunter. Alert. While resolving the hunter keyword, New Moon Stiltwalker's location is considered to be connected to each other location.

name: New Moon Tumbler
text: Hunter. Retaliate. While there is 1 or more doom on New Moon Tumbler, it gets +1 horror. While there is 2 or more doom on New Moon Tumbler, it gets +1 damage. Forced - After New Moon Tumbler attacks: Place 1 doom on New Moon Tumbler.

flavor: Ralph grimaces as he grapples with the valves.
name: Overloaded Engine
text: Revelation - Attach Overloaded Engine to Locomotive Engine and exhaust Ralph Dykstra. Forced - At the end of the round: Place 1 doom on Locomotive Engine. [action]: Test [combat] or [agility] (3). If you succeed, discard Overloaded Engine.

flavor: Carrie hollers to hold on tight for rough tracks.
name: Rickety Ride
text: Revelation - Exhaust Carrie Dykstra. Test [willpower] or [agility] (1). This test gets +1 difficulty for each connection you are from Locomotive Engine. If you fail, take 1 horror and lose 2 resources.

name: Piper at the Gates of Dawn
text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -2. -4 instead if there are 5 or more resources on this card.
[cultist]: -3. If there is a [[Hex]] treachery at your location, discard a card from your hand at random.
[tablet]: -3. If there is a [[Performer]] enemy at your location, lose 1 resource.
[elder_thing]: -3. -5 instead if this is a test against an [[Elite]] enemy.
back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -3. -5 instead if there are 5 or more resources on this card.
[cultist]: -4. If there is a [[Hex]] treachery at your location, discard 2 cards from your hand at random.
[tablet]: -4. If there is a [[Performer]] enemy at your location, lose 2 resources.
[elder_thing]: -4. -6 instead if this is a test against an [[Elite]] enemy.

name: Repeat Showing
text: Forced - At the end of the round, replenish all clues on each revealed The Big Top location.
back_text: You've been so used to facing the circus in dark and moonlit places that you almost didn't realize that there is a full moon shining down on the circus grounds. The moon is almost empty, but its light seems very real - just like the other illusions. In player order, each investigator without a [moon] token sealed on their investigator card searches the chaos bag for one and seals it on their investigator card. Each investigator who cannot seal a token loses an action.

name: Doom and Gloom
text: Forced - At the end of the round, replenish all clues on each revealed The Big Top location.
back_text: With each passing moment, the moon looms ever closer, as if descending onto the circus grounds. Surely a catastrophic illusion like that is beyond Blake's capacity, or he would have done it from the start... right? In player order, each investigator without a [moon] token sealed on their investigator card searches the chaos bag for one and seals it on their investigator card. Each investigator who cannot seal a token loses 1 action.

name: Whirling Spectacle
text: Forced - At the end of the round, replenish all clues on each revealed The Big Top location.
back_text: The illusions strobe and blare, overwhelming your senses from every angle and forcing you to your knees in physical pain at the assault. Each investigator who has not resigned is defeated and suffers a physical or mental trauma (choose one).

name: All's Fair
text:
Treat Circus Gates' printed text box as if it were (except for [[Traits]])
Investigators cannot enter The Big Top.
back_text: Once more, you slowly but deliberately unravel the illusions permeating the grounds and unmask the hidden entrance. You are now free to escape... but for the first time now, Sylvester Blake is in sight without crowds of innocents in need of protection. In spite of the other illusions, this may be your only chance to fight Blake without any handicaps. Reveal each The Big Top location and place an additional 1[per_investigator] clues on each. Put the set-aside Sylvester Blake into play between the three The Big Top locations.

name: Audience Participation (v.I)
text: [reaction] After a [moon] token is released at The Big Top, spend 1 clue: Seal that token on Sylvester Blake. [fast] If you are at The Big Top, spend 2 clues: Search the token bag for a [moon] token and seal it on Sylvester Blake. Objective - If Sylvester Blake would be defeated, you must immediately advance.
back_text: The ringmaster's tricks and tactics fail to fool you, and he collapses down, coughing black ichor. Blake's ever-present grin is clenched in hate, but still smiling as he rises up. His skin seems to fade into the shadow, and his form mutates. Rapidly Blake evolves into one of the horrid caprine creatures, only much larger, and with that same glint of intelligent malice still in its eyes. A primal scream from its many mouths rips through the air. Remove all damage from Sylvester Blake and flip him. If an investigator has Monstrous Transformation in their deck: The bestial roar from the abomination triggers a primal urge deep within you, one you've only felt since your assumption of the curse in New Orleans. A need to fight savagery with savagery. If Monstrous Transformation is in play, you may search the chaos bag for a [moon] token and seal it on The Black Goat. Otherwise, you may search your deck, discard pile, and hand for Monstrous Transformation and put it into play.

name: Audience Participation (v.II)
text: [reaction] After a [moon] token is released at The Big Top, spend 2 clues: Seal that token on Sylvester Blake. [fast] If you are at The Big Top, spend 2 clues: Search the token bag for a [moon] token and seal it on Sylvester Blake. Objective - If Sylvester Blake would be defeated, you must immediately advance.
back_text: The ringmaster's tricks and tactics fail to fool you, and he collapses down, coughing black ichor. Blake's ever-present grin is clenched in hate, but still smiling as he rises up. His skin seems to fade into the shadow, and his form mutates. Rapidly Blake evolves into one of the horrid caprine creatures, only much larger, and with that same glint of intelligent malice still in its eyes. A primal scream from its many mouths rips through the air. Remove all damage from Sylvester Blake and flip him. If an investigator has Monstrous Transformation in their deck: The bestial roar from the abomination triggers a primal urge deep within you, one you've only felt since your assumption of the curse in New Orleans. A need to fight savagery with savagery. If Monstrous Transformation is in play, you may search the chaos bag for a [moon] token and seal it on The Black Goat. Otherwise, you may search your deck, discard pile, and hand for Monstrous Transformation and put it into play.

name: Audience Participation (v.III)
text: [reaction] After a [moon] token is released at The Big Top, spend 2 clues and discard a card from your hand: Seal that token on Sylvester Blake. [fast] If you are at The Big Top, spend 2 clues: Search the token bag for a [moon] token and seal it on Sylvester Blake. Objective - If Sylvester Blake would be defeated, you must immediately advance.
back_text: The ringmaster's tricks and tactics fail to fool you, and he collapses down, coughing black ichor. Blake's ever-present grin is clenched in hate, but still smiling as he rises up. His skin seems to fade into the shadow, and his form mutates. Rapidly Blake evolves into one of the horrid caprine creatures, only much larger, and with that same glint of intelligent malice still in its eyes. A primal scream from its many mouths rips through the air. Remove all damage from Sylvester Blake and flip him. If an investigator has Monstrous Transformation in their deck: The bestial roar from the abomination triggers a primal urge deep within you, one you've only felt since your assumption of the curse in New Orleans. A need to fight savagery with savagery. If Monstrous Transformation is in play, you may search the chaos bag for a [moon] token and seal it on The Black Goat. Otherwise, you may search your deck, discard pile, and hand for Monstrous Transformation and put it into play.

name: The True Monster
text: [fast] Spend 1 clue: Search the chaos bag for a [moon] token and seal it on The Black Goat. Objective - If The Black Goat is defeated, you must immediately advance.
back_text: You have stepped into the role of the beast tamer in this mad circus. The monster lashes and bays with frightening power, but you beat it back with equal courage. With all of Blake's subtlety beaten, there is little left but monstrous strength, and as you prove with one final blow, it is not enough to stop you. (â†’R4)

flavor:
Can you possibly escape?
Do you even want to at such a critical reckoning?
name: Circus Gates
text: [action]: Resign. You escape before this trap spells your end.
back_flavor:
The circus sign looms above the iron bars,
glowing with the light of a moon
that shouldn't be shining down.

name: Sylvester Blake
subname: Ringmaster of the New Moon Circus
text: Massive. Retaliate. Alert. Sylvester Blake is considered to be at each The Big Top location. Forced - When Sylvester Blake would take any amount of damage: Release a [moon] token sealed on him. If you cannot, cancel that damage.

name: The Black Goat
text: Massive. is considered to be at each The Big Top location. Forced - When you initiate an attack against : You must either release a [moon] token from or it readies and makes an immediate attack against you.

name: Duplicitous Illusion
text: Revelation - Put Duplicitous Illusion into play in your threat area. Forced - When you activate an [action] ability on an asset you control: Reveal a random chaos token. If you reveal a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], [auto_fail], or [moon] token, place 1 doom on that asset. [action]: Search the bag for a [moon] token and seal it on your investigator card. Then, discard Duplicitous Illusion.

name: Phantom Beasts
text: Revelation - Attach Phantom Beasts to your location. Forced - At the end of the round, each investigator at the attached location tests [willpower] or [agility] (4). Each investigator that fails discards an asset they control. [reaction] After you successfully investigate the attached location: Instead of discovering clues, discard Phantom Beasts.

name: Shadowy Performance
text: Revelation - Attach Shadowy Performance to your location. Investigators at the attached location get -1 to each of their skills for each [moon] token sealed on their investigator card. Forced - At the end of the round, discard Shadowy Performance.

name: Bacchanalia
text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is equal to half the number of vices you have (rounded up).
[cultist]: -2. -4 instead if this test is an investigation attempt.
[tablet]: -2. -4 instead if there is a [[Cultist]] enemy at your location.
[elder_thing]: -2. -4 instead if this test is part of a parley action.
back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X. X is equal to 1 + half the number of vices you have (rounded up).
[cultist]: -3. -5 instead if this test is an investigation attempt.
[tablet]: -3. -5 instead if there is a [[Cultist]] enemy at your location.
[elder_thing]: -3. -5 instead if this test is part of a parley action.

name: Into the Lion's Den
back_text: The longer you spend in the manor, the more that their overindulgence affects you. You wonder if something supernatural is at work, or simply human nature at its worst, but you have to resist or escape the influence in either case. In player order, each investigator tests [willpower] or [agility] (X), where X is the total number of [moon] tokens sealed on investigator cards. Each investigator who fails must choose and discard half the cards in their hand and lose half the resources in their resource pool (rounded up).

name: Lack of Restraint
back_text: The society aren't content to debauch themselves, and continually offer to you to join in their wild activities. Can you resist their advances? In player order, each investigator tests [willpower] or [agility] (X), where X is the total number of [moon] tokens sealed on investigator cards. Each investigator who fails must choose and discard half the cards in their hand and lose half the resources in their resource pool (rounded up).

name: Fever Pitch
back_text: There's no real trigger for it, but the crowd inside the mansion has reached its break point, and is nothing more than a maddened mob in fancy clothing. You escape wild blows amid a din of animalistic fury, fleeing out the front door of the manor for your life. Each investigator is defeated and suffers a physical or mental trauma (choose one).

name: Behind Closed Doors
back_text: Having toured the manor extensively, you're already certain that anything hidden would be beneath the mansion, but it isn't until you schmooze with the society members for some time that someone lets secrets slip. The catacombs have a hidden entrance through the wine cellars connected to the kitchens, as well as one through a trap door hidden in the garden. You discover as well that the society has been holding sacrifices for the coming ritual, imprisoned in cells connected to their altar chamber. Given the chamber has no view of the moon, you doubt that the mansion is the site of tomorrow's ritual, but it's a start. Put each of the set-aside [[Restricted]] locations into play.

name: Deeper Profanities
text: Objective - After an investigator enters Savage Altar, you must immediately advance.
back_text: You cautiously enter the deepest chamber, taking care not to disturb the horrid structures. If there was any doubt at all before now, the altar to Shub-Niggurath lies at the very back, though not barren. Unlike the occult trappings, papers lie on the stone altar, each marked with scientific precision. The cult was tracking the exact path of the eclipse and determined the ideal place to conduct the ritual in its path. You have barely finished noting the ritual coordinates when the clack of cloven hooves on the stone floor sounds behind you. Spawn the set-aside Goatspawn Corruptor at Savage Altar. If both Manor Cellars and Hidden Dungeon are revealed, Goatspawn Corruptor enters play exhausted.

name: Fashionably Early
text: Objective - If each undefeated investigator has resigned, advance.
back_text: With the other wild partying still ongoing, you find it surprisingly easy to slip out the front door and retreat down the path back to the city. With any luck, nobody will notice your escape until you're back at the hotel. (â†’R2)

flavor: You don't want to stay long in a place this corrupt.
name: Vestibule
text: [action]: Resign. "It's been a wonderful evening, but I really must be going."
back_flavor: The entryway is merely the point of decision for the society. Which debauchery will they indulge in this time?

flavor:
Though fitting for all of the debauchery in the manor,
excess is the only way to describe the refreshments here.
name: Banquet Hall
text:
While you are investigating Banquet Hall, if you have "a vice for revelry," it gets -2 shroud value.
[fast] Spend 1 supply, ammo, charge, or secret from an asset you control: You get +1 skill value while parleying at Banquet Hall until the end of the round.
back_flavor: Judging by the strong smells of alcohol and expensive seasonings, you don't have to guess what you'll find here.

flavor:
The gardens are a quarantine for members to release their anger.
Broken statues and other damaged objects litter the grounds.
name: Statuary Gardens
text:
While you are investigating Statuary Gardens, if you have "a vice for violence," it gets -2 shroud value.
[reaction] After you deal 1 or more damage to an enemy at Statuary Gardens: You get +1 skill value while parleying at Statuary Gardens until the end of the round.
back_flavor:
The open air gardens are a breath of fresh air,
but the sounds of destruction echo up into the night.

flavor:
Society members mingle and tangle as they will,
and you're lucky if any of them can spare you a word in between.
name: Private Parlor
text:
While you are investigating Private Parlor, if you have "a vice for intimacy," it gets -2 shroud value.
[fast] Exhaust a non-[[Creature Ally]] asset you control: You get +1 skill value while parleying at Private Parlor until the end of the round.
back_flavor: The fragrance of perfume and varying degrees of laughter make it clear that it's adults only through this door.

flavor:
The way that the society members talk, you'd think that
each of them personally owned the whole gallery.
name: Collection Hall
text:
While you are investigating Collection Hall, if you have "a vice for opulence," it gets -2 shroud value.
You get +1 skill value while parleying at Collection Hall for every 5 resources in your resource pool.
back_flavor:
One look through the open door makes you wonder
if they'll charge admission.

flavor:
The balcony overlooks a sheer drop of three stories.
It would be a shame if anyone got careless in their partying.
name: Upper Balcony
text:
[reaction] After you evade an enemy at Upper Balcony by 2 or more: Defeat that enemy.
You get +1 skill value while parleying at Upper Balcony for every 4 cards in your hand.
back_flavor:
The roof of the society manor house seems to be
the only escape from the wild activities beneath it.

flavor: You must free these unfortunate victims!
name: Hidden Dungeon
text: Forced - After you reveal Hidden Dungeon, attach both set-aside copies of Terrified Captives to Hidden Dungeon. Shuffle each set-aside copy of Wild Hysteria into the encounter deck. While there are no clues on Hidden Dungeon, each test on a card attached to Hidden Dungeon gets -2 difficulty.
back_flavor:
The moment you pry open the hidden door in the garden,
the soft and muted sounds of distress come wafting up.

flavor:
It's more time consuming than tricky to find
the right barrel of wine with a false facade.
name: Manor Cellars
text: Investigators cannot move to Savage Altar from Manor Cellars while there are 1 or more clues on it. Forced - After an investigator moves to Manor Cellars from Savage Altar: Remove each clue from Manor Cellars.
back_flavor: The kitchen staff are likely too busy with their constant flow of food and drink to notice you slip down the cellar stairs.

flavor: What other secrets of the cult may be hidden here?
name: Savage Altar
text: Forced - When your turn begins at Savage Altar: You must either search the chaos bag for a [moon] token and seal it on your investigator card or lose 1 action (choose one).
back_flavor:
The musty smell of antiquity permeates the halls.
You wonder if this profane site even predates the manor.

flavor:
Mr. Sharpe makes it clear that he detests violence,
but is still very eager to talk about gruesome topics.
name: Cecil Sharpe
text: [action]: Parley. Test [combat] (5). If you have "a vice for violence," this test gets -2 difficulty. If you succeed, take control of 1 clue on Cecil Sharpe. If you succeed by 2 or more, take control of 1 additional clue or discover 1 clue from Cecil Sharpe's location. If you fail, take 1 damage.

flavor:
Ms. Meredith has a keen eye for very valuable things,
and getting her talking is a simple matter of quality.
name: Esther Meredith
text: [action]: Parley. Test [intellect] (5). If you have "a vice for opulence," this test gets -2 difficulty. If you succeed, take control of 1 clue on Esther Meredith. If you succeed by 2 or more, take control of 1 additional clue or discover 1 clue from Esther Meredith's location. If you fail, take 1 horror.

flavor:
While not a member, Mr. Hutchins is highly observant.
You might gain his trust by sharing your own misgivings.
name: Phillip Hutchins
text: [action]: Parley. Test any skill (2). This test gets +1 difficulty for each vice you have. If you succeed, take control of 1 clue on Phillip Hutchins. If you succeed by 2 or more, take control of 1 additional clue or discover 1 clue from Phillip Hutchins's location. If you fail, lose 1 action.

flavor:
Mr. Stratton is loose-lipped when he gets liquored up,
but is also known for his terrible temper.
name: Richard Stratton
text: [action]: Parley. Test [agility] (5). If you have "a vice for revelry," this test gets -2 difficulty. If you succeed, take control of 1 clue on Richard Stratton. If you succeed by 2 or more, take control of 1 additional clue or discover 1 clue from Richard Stratton's location. If you fail, take 1 damage.

flavor:
Ms. Ashcroft knows what she wants, but if you play along,
you might get some information in the process.
name: Vera Ashcroft
text: [action]: Parley. Test [willpower] (5). If you have "a vice for intimacy," this test gets -2 difficulty. If you succeed, take control of 1 clue on Vera Ashcroft. If you succeed by 2 or more, take control of 1 additional clue or discover 1 clue from Vera Ashcroft's location. If you fail, take 1 horror.

name: Goatspawn Corruptor
text:
While Goatspawn Corruptor is ready, Savage Altar gets +3 shroud value.
Goatspawn Corruptor gains retaliate and alert while engaged with an investigator with 1 or more [moon] tokens sealed on their investigator card.
[reaction] After you defeat Goatspawn Corruptor: Discover 1[per_investigator] clues from Savage Altar.

name: All That Glitters
text: Peril. Revelation - You must (choose one, two instead if you have "a vice for opulence"): - Lose 1 action. - Lose 3 resources. - Test [agility] (3). If you fail, lose 3 resources.

name: Best Left Unsaid
text: Revelation - Put Best Left Unsaid into play next to the agenda deck. Forced - After you take a parley action or end your turn at a [[Restricted]] location: You must place 1 of your clues on your location. If you cannot, take 1 damage and 1 horror. Forced - At the end of the round, discard Best Left Unsaid.

name: Brash Lothario
text: Aloof. Hunter. Prey - Investigator with "a vice for intimacy." Forced - At the end of the round, each investigator at Brash Lothario's location chooses and discards a card from their hand. Each investigator with "a vice for intimacy" chooses and discards an additional card. [action]: Parley. Test [willpower] or [intellect] (4). If you have "a vice for intimacy," this test gets +2 difficulty and other investigators cannot commit cards to it. If you succeed, discard Brash Lothario.

name: Destructive Impulses
text: Peril. Revelation - You must (choose one, two instead if you have "a vice for violence"): - Lose 1 action. - Take 2 damage. - Test [agility] (3). If you fail, take 2 damage.

name: Drink and Be Merry
text: Peril. Revelation - You must (choose one, two instead if you have "a vice for revelry"): - Lose 1 action. - Take 2 horror. - Test [willpower] (3). If you fail, take 2 horror.

name: Party Animal
text: Aloof. Hunter. Prey - Investigator with "a vice for revelry." Forced - At the end of the round, each investigator at Party Animal's location takes 1 horror. Each investigator with "a vice for revelry" takes 1 additional horror. [action]: Parley. Test [willpower] or [intellect] (4). If you have "a vice for revelry," this test gets +2 difficulty and other investigators cannot commit cards to it. If you succeed, discard Party Animal.

name: Perfume and Passion
text: Peril. Revelation - You must (choose one, two instead if you have "a vice for intimacy"): - Lose 1 action. - Choose and discard 2 cards from your hand. - Test [willpower] (3). If you fail, choose and discard 2 cards from your hand.

name: Sadistic Socialite
text: Aloof. Hunter. Prey - Investigator with "a vice for violence." Forced - At the end of the round, each investigator at Sadistic Socialite's location takes 1 damage. Each investigator with "a vice for violence" takes 1 additional damage. [action]: Parley. Test [willpower] or [intellect] (4). If you have "a vice for violence," this test gets +2 difficulty and other investigators cannot commit cards to it. If you succeed, discard Sadistic Socialite.

name: Strutting Peacock
text: Aloof. Hunter. Prey - Investigator with "a vice for opulence." Forced - At the end of the round, each investigator at Strutting Peacock's location loses a resource. Each investigator with "a vice for opulence" loses an additional resource. [action]: Parley. Test [willpower] or [intellect] (4). If you have "a vice for opulence," this test gets +2 difficulty and other investigators cannot commit cards to it. If you succeed, discard Strutting Peacock.

name: Red Sunrise
text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -1. -3 instead if there is a [[Monster]] or [[Cultist]] enemy in your row.
[cultist]: 0. If you do not succeed by X (where X is the number of locations in your row), draw the top card of the encounter deck.
[tablet]: 0. If you do not succeed by X (where X is the number of locations in your row), lose an action.
[elder_thing]: -2. If you fail, move the nearest enemy once toward your location.
back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -2. -4 instead if there is a [[Monster]] or [[Cultist]] enemy in your row.
[cultist]: -1. If you do not succeed by X (where X is the number of locations in your row), draw the top card of the encounter deck.
[tablet]: -1. If you do not succeed by X (where X is the number of locations in your row), lose an action.
[elder_thing]: -3. Move the nearest enemy once toward your location.

name: Fading Sunlight (v.I)
back_text: A chill runs through your spine as the woods darken around you. The eclipse has begun, and with the ritual still active, it will never end. A horrid cacophony of growling, baying, and shrieking resounds through the woods in the permanent twilight. Under the new moon, Shub-Niggurath has come. (â†’R1)

name: Fading Sunlight (v.II)
text:
Investigators cannot spend clues unless there is an enemy at their location.
[fast] If Devotee of the Thousand is set aside: Spawn it at your location.
back_text: A chill runs through your spine as the woods darken around you. The eclipse has begun, and with the ritual still active, it will never end. A horrid cacophony of growling, baying, and shrieking resounds through the woods in the permanent twilight. Under the new moon, Shub-Niggurath has come. (â†’R1)

name: Forest of Giants (v.I)
text: [fast] Investigators spend X[per_investigator] clues as a group, where X is 1 less than the number of locations in your row: Flip the facedown Path Forward card beside your row faceup. Objective - After an investigator enters Ritual Clearing, you must immediately advance.
back_text: Your entrance to the ritual site is met with a scene of near chaos. Deprived of their leader due to your slaying of Sylvester Blake, the remaining cultists are in a state of mindless zealotry, and advance on you like demons possessed to salvage their one chance at appeasing their terrible mistress. Spawn the set-aside The Cult En Masse (Leaderless Fanaticism) at Ritual Clearing.

name: Forest of Giants (v.II)
text: [fast] Investigators spend X[per_investigator] clues as a group, where X is 1 less than the number of locations in your row: Flip the facedown Path Forward card beside your row faceup. Objective - After an investigator enters Ritual Clearing, you must immediately advance.
back_text: Your entrance to the ritual site is met with the towering figure of the Black Goat - formerly Blake, before his transformation. All showmanship is lost, but it brays hatefully with discordant tones, and the cult advances upon you to defend its master's ritual. Spawn the set-aside The Cult En Masse (Black Goat's Rapture) at Ritual Clearing.

name: Forest of Giants (v.III)
text: [fast] Investigators spend X[per_investigator] clues as a group, where X is 1 less than the number of locations in your row: Flip the facedown Path Forward card beside your row faceup. Objective - After an investigator enters Ritual Clearing, you must immediately advance.
back_text: Your entrance to the ritual site is met with much pomp, as Sylvester Blake turns and bows with a sweeping flourish. You are well familiar with his twisted showmanship after your last two encounters with him. "Ladies and gentlemen of the All-Mother, behold our final act! Witness the destined performers playing their parts in the age-old destiny! Can they defy death once more? That, dear friends, is for you to determine!" Blake raises his hands once more as if directing an orchestra, and the cult advances toward you. Spawn the set-aside The Cult En Masse (Ringmaster's Fervor) at Ritual Clearing.

name: Impending Zenith
text: [action] If you are at Ritual Clearing: Reveal 5 random chaos tokens. Investigators as a group at your location may move 1 clue they control to this act, plus 1 additional clue for each [moon] token you reveal. Objective - If there are 2[per_investigator] clues on this act, advance.
back_text: Not wasting a moment, you pore through the cult paraphernalia to undo the formative spell. With stolen incantations and materials, you break the magic circle, and the eldritch glow begins to fade, just as the edges of the sun and moon touch. (â†’R2)

flavor: You have yet to brave the true dangers of the forest.
name: Forgotten Trail
text: Investigators at Forgotten Trail get +1 skill value during tests on encounter cards.
back_flavor: A lonely path of dirt and bare stone slowly disappears into the foliage. From here on, you're on your own.

flavor:
With each passing second, the moon and sun
draw ever closer to each other.
name: Ritual Clearing
text: [action] Search the chaos bag for a [moon] token and seal it on your investigator card: Discover 1 clue from Ritual Clearing.
back_flavor: Chanting carries on the wind through the forest. Their ritual has already begun.

flavor:
The slanted hill makes close examination difficult,
if not impossible.
name: Foothill Slope
text: Forced - After you discover 1 or more clues from this location: Lose an action.
back_flavor:
