Slanted as the ground is,
the trees here still grow tall and upright.

flavor:
It's difficult to find your footing anywhere that
the cult might have traveled here.
name: Foothill Slope
text: Each investigator cannot discover more than 1 clue from this location each round.
back_flavor:
Slanted as the ground is,
the trees here still grow tall and upright.

flavor:
The sloped ground is surprisingly useful
for fast getaways.
name: Foothill Slope
text: [reaction] After you evade an enemy at this location: Move to a connecting location.
back_flavor:
Slanted as the ground is,
the trees here still grow tall and upright.

flavor: Difficult as it is, the cult and its monsters may leave greater evidence on the difficult terrain.
name: Foothill Slope
text: [reaction] After you defeat an enemy at this location: Discover a clue.
back_flavor:
Slanted as the ground is,
the trees here still grow tall and upright.

flavor:
The mud surrounding the river is easy to search,
but cold and damp in the early morning.
name: Mountain Stream
text: Forced - After you discover 1 or more clues from this location: Exhaust 2 assets you control (with printed abilities, if possible).
back_flavor:
The quiet burbling of a cold water stream both
breaks up the silence and adds to the tension.

flavor:
The river constantly threatens to
wash away all trace of the cultists.
name: Mountain Stream
text: Forced - After you end your turn at this location: Place 1 of your clues on this location.
back_flavor:
The quiet burbling of a cold water stream both
breaks up the silence and adds to the tension.

flavor: The brook is welcome refreshment on this long trek through the California forest.
name: Mountain Stream
text: [action] [action]: Heal 1 damage and 1 horror.
back_flavor:
The quiet burbling of a cold water stream both
breaks up the silence and adds to the tension.

flavor:
The cold water helps to clear your head
at the very least.
name: Mountain Stream
text: [action]: Release a [moon] token sealed on your investigator card. (Limit once per round.)
back_flavor:
The quiet burbling of a cold water stream both
breaks up the silence and adds to the tension.

flavor: There is little to find in this open grove.
name: Open Forest
text: Investigators cannot trigger [fast] abilities while investigating at this location.
back_flavor:
Morning sunlight fills the widely-spaced trees,
but doesn't put you at ease at all.

flavor: The sparse trees make it harder to run or hide.
name: Open Forest
text: Investigators cannot trigger [fast] abilities while evading at this location.
back_flavor:
Morning sunlight fills the widely-spaced trees,
but doesn't put you at ease at all.

flavor: There's not much room for nuance fighting here.
name: Open Forest
text: Investigators cannot trigger [fast] abilities while attacking at this location.
back_flavor:
Morning sunlight fills the widely-spaced trees,
but doesn't put you at ease at all.

flavor:
It's almost too easy to pick up the trail here.
Is it an ambush?
name: Shadowed Wilderness
text: Forced - After you discover 1 or more clues from this location, move the nearest non-[[Elite]] enemy once toward this location. If no enemy moves via this effect, draw the top card of the encounter deck.
back_flavor:
The boughs of these sequoias are thick enough
to partially block the light of the morning sun.

flavor: It's easy to lose the trail in these dense woods.
name: Shadowed Wilderness
text: Forced - After you discover 1 or more clues from Shadowed Wilderness: It gets +2 shroud until the end of the round.
back_flavor:
The boughs of these sequoias are thick enough
to partially block the light of the morning sun.

flavor: Does the cover make it easier for you or the cultists?
name: Shadowed Wilderness
text:
Investigators at this location get +1 [agility].
Enemies at this location gain alert.
back_flavor:
The boughs of these sequoias are thick enough
to partially block the light of the morning sun.

flavor:
With the right use of the foliage,
the enemy may not even know you're here.
name: Shadowed Wilderness
text: [reaction] After a non-[[Elite]] enemy enters this location, if there are no other enemies at this location: It gains aloof until the end of the round.
back_flavor:
The boughs of these sequoias are thick enough
to partially block the light of the morning sun.

flavor:
The cultists may feel less need to cover their tracks
in this darker patch of woods.
name: Shadowed Wilderness
text: This location gets -1 shroud value while there are 1 or more enemies at this location (-2 shroud value instead if there are any exhausted enemies at this location).
back_flavor:
The boughs of these sequoias are thick enough
to partially block the light of the morning sun.

name: Path Forward
text: If the leftmost location in this row is revealed and there are no clues on it, that location is connected to each location in the row above it. The leftmost location in the above row gains Victory 1. This victory applies even if there is only one location in the above row.

name: Path Forward
text: If the second location from the left in this row is revealed and there are no clues on it, that location is connected to each location in the row above it. The second location from the left in the above row gains Victory 1. This victory applies even if there is only one location in the above row.

name: Path Forward
text: If the second location from the right in this row is revealed and there are no clues on it, that location is connected to each location in the row above it. The second location from the right in the above row gains Victory 1. This victory applies even if there is only one location in the above row.

name: Path Forward
text: If the rightmost location in this row is revealed and there are no clues on it, that location is connected to each location in the row above it. The rightmost location in the above row gains Victory 1. This victory applies even if there is only one location in the above row.

name: The Cult En Masse
text:
Massive. Retaliate. Alert.
The Cult En Masse cannot move or be moved.
While The Cult En Masse is ready, treat each [moon] token revealed during abilities on the act, or during attacks and investigations at its location as a [auto_fail] token instead.

name: The Cult En Masse
text:
Massive. Alert.
The Cult En Masse cannot move or be moved.
While The Cult En Masse is ready, treat each [moon] token revealed during abilities on the act, or during attacks and investigations at its location as a [auto_fail] token instead.

name: The Cult En Masse
text:
Massive.
The Cult En Masse cannot move or be moved.
While The Cult En Masse is ready, treat each [moon] token revealed during abilities on the act, or during attacks and investigations at its location as a [auto_fail] token instead.

flavor: The cultist proceeds slowly, but warily to the site.
name: Devotee of the Thousand
text: Hunter. Retaliate. Alert. Forced - When Devotee of the Thousand would leave play: Instead, set it aside, out of play.

name: Crashing Trees
text: Revelation - Test [agility] (3). If there are 1 or more [moon] token sealed on your investigator card, you cannot activate [fast] or [reaction] abilities during this test. If there are 2 or more, non-weakness cards cannot be committed to this test. If you fail, you must either spawn the topmost enemy in the encounter discard pile at your location, or take 1 damage for each point you fail by.

name: Malicious Goatspawn
text: Hunter. Alert. Forced - After Malicious Goatspawn attacks you: Take 1 damage or 1 horror for each [moon] token sealed on your investigator card.

name: Roaming Dark Young
text: Hunter. Alert. Spawn - Any empty location. Forced - After you enter Roaming Dark Young's location: Search the chaos bag for a [moon] token and seal it on your investigator card.

name: Silent Forest
text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). If there are 1 or more [moon] token sealed on your investigator card, you cannot activate [fast] or [reaction] abilities during this test. If there are 2 or more, non-weakness cards cannot be committed to this test. If you fail, you must either spawn the topmost enemy in the encounter discard pile at your location, or take 1 horror for each point you fail by.

name: Thousand to One
text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is the number of [moon] tokens sealed on investigator cards at your location.
[cultist]: -3. If a [moon] token is revealed during this test, choose and discard a card from your hand.
[tablet]: -3. If a [moon] token is revealed during this test, lose a resource.
[elder_thing]: -3. If you fail, search the chaos bag for a [moon] token and seal it on your investigator card.
back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X. X is equal to 1 + the number of [moon] tokens sealed on investigator cards at your location.
[cultist]: -4. If a [moon] token is revealed during this test, choose and discard a card from your hand.
[tablet]: -4. If a [moon] token is revealed during this test, lose a resource.
[elder_thing]: -4. Search the chaos bag for a [moon] token and seal it on your investigator card.

name: Under Moonless Skies
text: Forced - At the end of the round, discard each player card attached to a [[Tainted]] location. (This scenario will not end when the agenda advances!)
back_text: Trees splinter apart - even building-sized redwoods - as Shub-Niggurath advances towards the site of the ritual. The means to its permanent rule of Earth are close at hand, and it will not allow its followers to fail as they did nearly two thousand years ago. Fulfill the prophecy before it's too late! Move Shub-Niggurath once toward Silent Clearing. If Shub-Niggurath is not at Silent Clearing, flip this agenda back to its 'a' side. Otherwise, remove the act and agenda from the game and advance to the set-aside The Prophecy Unfulfilled. It is both the current act and the current agenda. Then, in your Campaign Log, record that the prophecy was unfulfilled. Do not abandon the clearing before the eclipse passes!

name: Age-Old Visions
text: Objective - If there are 1[per_investigator] [[Destiny]] story cards in the victory display and 1 or more investigators are at Silent Clearing, you may advance. (Be prepared for a fight!)
back_text: There's something uncanny about living up to the words of someone who would never know you, and yet you stand at the ritual clearing with her words fulfilled. Your defiant stand is met by Shub-Niggurath itself, slavering and shrieking with its thousands of mouths, and bearing its horrid progeny with it. Fight with all your strength for this final stand! Exhaust Shub-Niggurath, remove all damage from it, and move it to Silent Clearing. Remove the act and agenda from the game and advance to the set-aside The Prophecy Fulfilled. It is both the current act and the current agenda. Then, in your Campaign Log, record that the prophecy was fulfilled. Do not abandon the clearing before the eclipse passes!

name: The Prophecy Fulfilled
text: Forced - When the investigation phase ends: Remove all damage from Shub-Niggurath. If fewer than 3[per_investigator] damage was removed, ready Shub-Niggurath. Forced - At the end of the round: Remove all doom from each other card in play. For each doom removed, Shub-Niggurath makes an immediate attack against an investigator, regardless of location. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase, if there are no investigators at Silent Clearing, advance. Objective - When this agenda would advance by reaching its doom threshold: Instead, (â†’R2).
back_text: With no one to contest the ritual site, the minions of Shub-Niggurath swoop in to reclaim the clearing. Before the eclipse can reach its end, the magic resumes, and the celestial sphere locks in place. It is over. (â†’R1)

name: The Prophecy Unfulfilled
text: Forced - When the investigation phase ends: Remove all damage from Shub-Niggurath. If fewer than 5[per_investigator] damage was removed, ready Shub-Niggurath. Forced - At the end of the round: Remove all doom from each other card in play. For each doom removed, Shub-Niggurath makes an immediate attack against an investigator, regardless of location. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase, if there are no investigators at Silent Clearing, advance. Objective - When this agenda would advance by reaching its doom threshold: Instead, (â†’R2).
back_text: With no one to contest the ritual site, the minions of Shub-Niggurath swoop in to reclaim the clearing. Before the eclipse can reach its end, the magic resumes, and the celestial sphere locks in place. It is over. (â†’R1)

flavor:
If you can understand the cult trappings,
then you might use them to defend this position.
name: Silent Clearing
text: [action] Spend 1-2 clues: Fight. This attack uses [intellect] instead of [combat]. You get +X [intellect] and deal +X damage for this attack, where X is the amount of clues spent. [reaction] When a non-[[Elite]] enemy attacks an investigator at Silent Clearing, spend 1 clue: Cancel that attack.
back_flavor:
The cult has retreated, leaving you in control of their
ritual circle and its arcane implements.

flavor: Why did you come here? Are you mad?
name: Primal Forest
text: Forced - After Shub-Niggurath leaves Primal Forest, move each investigator and other enemy at Primal Forest once toward Silent Clearing. Move this location to the victory display.
back_flavor:
You know in your heart that the monstrous sounds
are not of one creature, but thousands.
back_text: Forced - After Shub-Niggurath leaves Primal Forest, move each other enemy at Primal Forest once toward Silent Clearing and remove this location from the game.

flavor: Beware, for the howls and bleats grow nearer.
name: High Thicket
text: Forced - After Shub-Niggurath leaves High Thicket, move each investigator and other enemy at High Thicket once toward Silent Clearing and remove this location from the game.
back_flavor:
The redwoods are thick and dense in this region,
yet not enough to block the movement of horrid things.
back_text: Forced - After Shub-Niggurath leaves High Thicket, move each other enemy at High Thicket once toward Silent Clearing and remove this location from the game.

flavor:
The stress of being out in the open with these
horrible creatures bearing down strains your mind.
name: Sparse Woodland
text: Each investigator at Sparse Woodland gets -2 maximum hand size for each [moon] token sealed on their investigator card.
back_flavor:
Compared to the towering redwoods nearby,
this region is low and open, and quite vulnerable.

flavor:
Searching the overgrown glade is difficult
under the dark eclipse, to say the least.
name: Mossy Glen
text: [reaction] After you release a [moon] token at Mossy Glen: Replenish 1 clue on Mossy Glen.
back_flavor: The buildup of moss and lichen in this area speaks to its sheer age and lack of exploration by humans.

flavor:
It's possible that some of the cult paraphernalia
has been trapped under the fallen trees.
name: Fallen Copse
text: [fast] Choose and discard a non-weakness asset you control: Replenish up to 4 clues on Fallen Copse.
back_flavor: Several of the smaller trees in this area have been toppled and ripped out of the ground from the sheer force of the dark young moving.

name: Strike the Heart
text: In the toppled treeline behind you, a horrid growl utters. You turn, expecting another of the bestial dark young, but your eyes settle on a different monster. Its form is not unlike the dark young, but a disturbing semblance of humanity lingers about its conjoined faces. Below, in a cavity bisecting its chest, a visible heart pulses slowly. Your destiny in the tome flashes into your mind - strike the heart. To fulfill the ancient vision, you must be the one to fell this abomination. Flip this card over and put it into play at Fallen Copse, exhausted.

name: Malformed Dark Young
text: Hunter. Retaliate. Prey - Investigator whose destiny is "heart" only. cannot be defeated by attacks or effects triggered by investigators whose destiny is not "heart." Forced - After is defeated: Flip it and move it to the victory display.

name: Silence the Pipes
text: From the ancient and overgrown foliage, a soft but discordant sound lingers in the air. The music is rapid, but subdued, not unlike the hypnotic cadence of a snake charmer. The horrid piping gnaws at your sanity, but lends strength to the scattered cult and its monsters. Your destiny in the tome flashes into your mind - silence the pipes. To fulfill the ancient vision, you must be the one to seek out and stop this profane song. Flip this card over and put it into play at Mossy Glen.

name: Piper of Shub-Niggurath
text: cannot be defeated. Forced - After takes 1 or more damage from an investigator whose destiny is not "pipes": It disengages and moves to a connecting location. [action] If your destiny is "pipes": Parley. You challenge the piper in a game of skill. Test any skill (12). This test gets -1 difficulty for each damage on . If you succeed, flip it and move it to the victory display.

name: Raise the Torch
text: The sound of dull chanting reaches your ears, low and echoing. You recognize the foul words from the earlier incantations at the ritual circle, but they are somehow different. You don't know what spell the cult is weaving, but judging on sound alone, they are performing it somewhere deep and hidden, likely a nearby cave. Your destiny in the tome flashes into your mind - raise the torch. To fulfill the ancient vision, you must be the one to illuminate their den and stymie their magic. Flip this card over and put it into play.

name: Forest Chasm
text: The last clue on cannot be discovered or moved by investigators whose destiny is not "torch." Forced - If there are no clues on : Move each investigator and enemy on it to a connecting location, flip it, and move it to the victory display.

name: Split the Rock
text: The violent braying of the dark young echoes not far beyond the clearing. The foul beasts are amassing in numbers that would surely overwhelm you. Through the foliage, you can barely make out the entrance to a deep ravine, with a tall rock formation looming just above it. Your destiny in the tome flashes into your mind - split the rock. To fulfill the ancient vision, you must be the one to break this rock and block the advancement of the monsters. Flip this card over and put it into play.

name: Canyon Entrance
text: [action]: Test [combat] or [agility] (4). If you succeed, place 1 damage on . If there is 3 damage on , investigators whose destiny is not "rock" cannot activate the above ability. Forced - If there is 4 damage on : Move each investigator and enemy on it to a connecting location, flip it, and move it to the victory display.

name: Scribe the Sigil
text: The glow of otherworldly magic seeps through the treeline, deepening the red color of the redwoods. It emanates from cracks in the trees, no doubt concocted by the cultists for some evil purpose. However, judging from the symbology you have seen in the past weeks, the markings look incomplete. Your destiny in the tome flashes into your mind - scribe the sigil. To fulfill the ancient vision, you must be the one to finish these symbols as something the cult did not intend. Flip this card over and put it into play.

name: Marked Grove
text: [action]: Test [willpower] or [intellect] (4). If you succeed, place 1 horror on . If there is 3 horror on , investigators whose destiny is not "sigil" cannot activate the above ability. Forced - If there is 4 horror on : Move each investigator and enemy on it to a connecting location, flip it, and move it to the victory display.

name: Cleanse the Stain
text: At the edge of the clearing, a trail of trees adorned with profane symbols and implements leads further out into the forest. Around each one, the stench of decay and an aura of fear linger. The woods have been tainted by the primordial magic of the cult as they prepared for the ritual. Your destiny in the tome flashes into your mind - cleanse the stain. To fulfill the ancient vision, you must be the one to find and purify the most corrupted area. Flip this card over and put it into play with 6 resources on it.

name: Defiled Woods
text: [action] Choose and discard cards from your hand with 2 or more total skill icons: Remove 1 resource from . If there is exactly 1 resource on , investigators whose destiny is not "stain" cannot activate the above ability. Forced - If there are no resources on : Move each investigator and enemy on it to a connecting location, flip it, and move it to the victory display.

name: Recite the Prayer
text: The sight of the dark moon shrouding the sun fills you with dread. The cosmic event seems beyond your power to influence at all. And yet, when faced with similar despair, Apuleius sought protection from a higher power, and whether or not Diana gave aid, the act braced his mind. Your destiny in the tome flashes into your mind - recite the prayer. To fulfill the ancient vision, you must be the one to beseech Diana for aid, as the old scholar did. Flip this card over and put it into play next to the act deck.

name: Diana's Blessing
text:
The [elder_sign] token cannot be sealed.
[reaction] When a [moon] token is released from a card at your location, place 1 resource on <fullnameb>.
[action]: Reveal X random chaos tokens from the chaos bag, where X is the number of resources on <fullnameb>. If an [elder_sign] token is revealed, flip <fullnameb> and add it to the victory display.

name: Bear the Burden
text: The darkness of the eclipse seems more than physical in this moment. The vanishing sun represents the real possibility that humanity could be wiped from the face of the earth. The strain could break most anyone else who knew the stakes in play. Your destiny in the tome flashes into your mind - bear the burden. To fulfill the ancient vision, you must be the one to embrace this darkness and carry it until the end of the eclipse. Flip this card over and put it into play next to the act deck.

name: Dark of the Moon
text:
[action] If there are 5 or more [moon] tokens sealed among cards you control: Flip <fullnameb> and add it to the victory display.
[action] [action]: Reveal 4 random chaos tokens from the bag. Investigators at your location may place any amount of clues they control on that location to reveal 2 additional tokens per clue placed. Seal each [moon] token revealed on your investigator card.

flavor:
Each passing moment spawns a new horrid
creature from the body of Shub-Niggurath.
name: Ravenous Brood
text: Hunter. Retaliate. X is equal to the number of players. Cards cannot be attached to Ravenous Brood. Forced - If Ravenous Brood would leave play: Set it aside, out of play.

flavor: Each passing moment spawns a new horrid creature from the body of Shub-Niggurath.
name: Ravenous Brood
text: Hunter. Alert. Ravenous Brood gets +X fight, where X is the number of players. Cards cannot be attached to Ravenous Brood. Forced - If Ravenous Brood would leave play: Set it aside, out of play.

name: Baleful Eclipse
text: Revelation - Put Baleful Eclipse into play next to the agenda deck. Forced - When the mythos phase begins: Each investigator with 1 or more [moon] tokens sealed on their investigator card loses 1 action. Discard Baleful Eclipse.

name: Dark Young Juggernaut
text: Hunter. Spawn - Any location the same number of connections from you as Shub-Niggurath. Forced - After Dark Young Juggernaut moves to your location: Deal 1 direct damage to each asset you control.

name: Dread of the New Moon
text: Revelation - If there are 5 or more [moon] token tokens sealed on cards, Dread of the New Moon gains surge. Otherwise, test [willpower] or [agility] (X), where X is the number of [moon] tokens in the chaos bag. If you fail, search the chaos bag for a [moon] token and seal it on your investigator card. If you fail by 2 or more, search your deck or discard pile for a weakness and draw it. Shuffle your deck if it was searched.

name: Hunger of Thousands
text: Revelation - The furthest ready Ravenous Brood from all investigators flips and immediately resolves its hunter keyword and attacks as if it were the enemy phase. If flipping the Ravenous Brood would defeat it, instead heal it until it has 1 health remaining.

name: Ire of Shub-Niggurath
text: Revelation - Put Ire of Shub-Niggurath into play in your threat area. Forced - When you would trigger a [fast] or [reaction] ability on a card you control: Reveal a random chaos token. If you reveal a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], [auto_fail], or [moon] token, cancel that activation. That ability cannot be activated until the end of the current phase. (Max once per ablity each round.) [reaction] After a [moon] token is released at your location: Discard Ire of Shub-Niggurath.

name: Shub-Niggurath
text: Massive. Retaliate. Shub-Niggurath cannot make attacks of opportunity or be moved by player effects. Forced - At the end of the round: If there is no horror on Shub-Niggurath, place 1 horror on Shub-Niggurath. Otherwise, remove 1 horror from Shub-Niggurath and spawn a set-aside copy of Ravenous Brood at Shub-Niggurath's location. The investigators may choose which side to spawn face-up.

name: Endless Spawn
text: Revelation - Attach Endless Spawn to your location. Forced - At the end of the round, if there are no enemies at this location: Search the encounter deck and discard pile for a [[Monster]] enemy and spawn it at the attached location. Shuffle the encounter deck if it was searched. [action]: Test [agility] (3). If you succeed, discard Endless Spawn. You may search the chaos bag for a [moon] token and seal it on your investigator card to automatically succeed.

flavor: Already horrid in appearance, the thing makes you shudder to think of how much worse it could get.
name: Nascent Dark Young
text: Hunter. Forced - When an investigator with 1 or more [moon] tokens sealed on their investigator card deals damage to Nascent Dark Young: Reduce that damage by 1 (to a minimum of 1).

flavor: The bestial man's eyes glint with savage cruelty.
name: Twisted Satyr
text: Hunter. Retaliate. Forced - When you defeat Twisted Satyr: Search the chaos bag for a [moon] token and seal it on your investigator card. If you cannot, take 1 horror instead.

flavor:
The cages for the horrid creatures are dark,
but filled with traces of magic.
name: Animal Cages
text: Animal Cages gets -1 shroud value for each [moon] token sealed on player cards at its location (to a minimum of 1 shroud).
back_flavor: The iron-barred wagons for the circus animals are sturdily built, far more than need be for even the largest of them.

flavor:
Some familiarity with the carousel should allow you
to use its motion for your own benefit.
name: Carousel
text: While there are no clues on Carousel, it gains "[reaction] After you move to Carousel: Move to a connecting location. (Limit once per round.)"
back_flavor: Among the many attractions set up by the traveling circus to amuse visitors, the painted carousel is frequently a delight.

flavor: There's a good chance that some of the tools and materials used in the booths could be of use to you.
name: Games Gallery
text: While there are no clues on Games Gallery it gains: "[action]: Search the top 9 cards of your deck for an [[Item]] asset and draw it. (Limit once per game.)"
back_flavor: This row of tents and booths boasts shooting ranges, strength testers, and other games of skill.

flavor:
The circus performers are unlikely to appreciate
you rooting through their belongings.
name: Performer Trailers
text: Performer Trailers get +1 shroud value while there are 1 or more ready [[Performer]] enemies at this location. While there are 1 or more investigators at Performer Trailers, each [[Performer]] enemy gains "Prey - Investigator at Performer Trailers."
back_flavor:
Minimal carts for the employee housing are set up
at the fringe of the circus grounds.

flavor:
The circus beasts - if beasts they really are -
have been trained to gather at the first ring.
name: The Big Top
text: Moving between The Big Top locations does not provoke attacks of opportunity. Forced - After you discover 1 or more clues from this location: Ready the nearest [[Creature]] or [[Monster]] enemy and resolve its hunter keyword.
back_flavor:
The first ring is frequently the site for the animal acts to perform. Elephants, lions and tigers, dancing bears,
and yet others... or perhaps not as they seem.

flavor: The trapezes, seesaws, and other athletic equipment kept in the second ring are readily available to the circus performers.
name: The Big Top
text: Moving between The Big Top locations does not provoke attacks of opportunity. Forced - After you discover 1 or more clues from this location: Ready the nearest [[Performer]] enemy and resolve its hunter keyword.
back_flavor:
The second ring hosts the athletes and acrobats performing feats of strength and dexterity. With their physicality,
they're likely very deadly opponents to face.

flavor: Though meant for the clowns' use, the third ring seems designed to assist wild and seemingly uncontrolled movement.
name: The Big Top
text:
Moving between The Big Top locations does not provoke attacks of opportunity.
[reaction] After you fail a skill test by 1 at this location: Immediately take a move or evade action. (Limit once per round.)
back_flavor:
The third ring is where the clowns congregate with all
the props and scenery they require for their antics.
Can you trust such sly performers?

name: Milk of Shub-Niggurath
text: Revelation - Attach Milk of Shub-Niggurath to a non-[[Elite]] enemy without a copy attached. If Milk of Shub-Niggurath cannot attach to an enemy, it gains surge. Attached enemy gains "Forced - At the end of the mythos phase: Place 1 doom on the attached enemy."

name: Supplicant of the Goat
text: Spawn - Any connecting location. Forced - When you engage Supplicant of the Goat, you must (choose one): - Search the chaos bag for a [moon] token and seal it on your investigator card. - Supplicant of the Goat attacks you.

name: Amalthea Weaver
text:
You get +1 [willpower].
[fast] During a skill test at your location, exhaust Amalthea Weaver: The performing investigator gets +X skill value for this test, where X is half the number of [moon] tokens sealed on cards at your location (rounded up).

name: Amalthea Weaver
text:
You get +1 [willpower].
[fast] During a skill test at your location, exhaust Amalthea Weaver: The performing investigator gets +X skill value for this test, where X is half the number of [moon] tokens sealed on cards at your location (rounded up). If this test is successful, you may release a token sealed on a card at your location.

name: Amalthea Weaver
text:
You get +1 [willpower].
[fast] During a skill test at your location, exhaust Amalthea Weaver: The performing investigator gets +X skill value for this test, where X is half the number of [moon] tokens sealed on cards at your location (rounded up). If this test is successful, you or the performing investigator may draw a card.

name: Amalthea Weaver
text:
You get +1 [willpower].
[fast] During a skill test at your location, exhaust Amalthea Weaver: The performing investigator gets +X skill value for this test, where X is half the number of [moon] tokens sealed on cards at your location (rounded up). If this test is successful, you may release up to 2 tokens sealed on cards at your location.

name: Amalthea Weaver
text:
You get +1 [willpower] and +1 [combat]
[fast] During a skill test at your location, exhaust Amalthea Weaver: The performing investigator gets +X skill value for this test, where X is half the number of [moon] tokens sealed on cards at your location (rounded up). If this test is successful, you may release a token sealed on a card at your location.

name: Amalthea Weaver
text:
You get +1 [willpower].
[fast] During a skill test at your location, exhaust Amalthea Weaver: The performing investigator gets +X skill value for this test, where X is half the number of [moon] tokens sealed on cards at your location (rounded up). If this test is successful, you or the performing investigator may draw 2 cards and discard one of them.

name: Amalthea Weaver
text:
You get +1 [willpower].
[fast] During a skill test at your location, exhaust Amalthea Weaver: The performing investigator gets +X skill value for this test, where X is half the number of [moon] tokens sealed on cards at your location (rounded up). If this test is successful, you or the performing investigator may draw the top or bottom card of their deck.

name: De Cultus Bestiae
text:
You get +1 [intellect].
[action] If there are no tokens sealed on De Cultus Bestiae: Search the chaos bag for a [moon] token and seal it on De Cultus Bestiae. This action does not provoke attacks of opportunity.
[fast]: Release a token sealed on De Cultus Bestiae.

name: De Cultus Bestiae
text:
You get +1 [intellect].
[action] If there are 1 or fewer tokens sealed on De Cultus Bestiae: Search the chaos bag for a [moon] token and seal it on De Cultus Bestiae. This action does not provoke attacks of opportunity.
[fast]: Release a token sealed on De Cultus Bestiae.

name: De Cultus Bestiae
text:
You get +1 [intellect].
[action] If there are no tokens sealed on De Cultus Bestiae: Search the chaos bag for a [moon] token and seal it on De Cultus Bestiae. This action does not provoke attacks of opportunity.
[fast]: Release a token sealed on De Cultus Bestiae. Heal 1 damage or 1 horror from an investigator or [[Ally]] asset at your location.

name: De Cultus Bestiae
text:
You get +1 [intellect].
[action] If there are 2 or fewer tokens sealed on De Cultus Bestiae: Search the chaos bag for a [moon] token and seal it on De Cultus Bestiae. This action does not provoke attacks of opportunity.
[fast]: Release a token sealed on De Cultus Bestiae.

name: De Cultus Bestiae
text:
You get +1 [intellect] and +1 [agility].
[action] If there are 1 or fewer tokens sealed on De Cultus Bestiae: Search the chaos bag for a [moon] token and seal it on De Cultus Bestiae. This action does not provoke attacks of opportunity.
[fast]: Release a token sealed on De Cultus Bestiae.

name: De Cultus Bestiae
text:
You get +1 [intellect].
[action] If there are no tokens sealed on De Cultus Bestiae: Search the chaos bag for a [moon] token and seal it on De Cultus Bestiae. This action does not provoke attacks of opportunity.
[fast]: Release a token sealed on De Cultus Bestiae. Heal 1 damage or 1 horror from up to 2 investigators or [[Ally]] assets at your location.

name: De Cultus Bestiae
text:
You get +1 [intellect].
[action] If there are no tokens sealed on De Cultus Bestiae: Search the chaos bag for a [moon] token and seal it on De Cultus Bestiae. This action does not provoke attacks of opportunity.
[fast]: Release a token sealed on De Cultus Bestiae. Heal 2 damage or 2 horror (or any combination thereof) from an investigator or [[Ally]] asset at your location.

flavor: Lumine lunae ductus.
name: Invocation of Diana
text:
Max 1 committed per skill test.
Cancel each [moon] token revealed during this test. If this test is successful, the performing investigator may draw two cards or release up to two [moon] tokens sealed on cards they control.

name: Hypnotic Glamour
text: Revelation - Attach Hypnotic Glamour to the revealed location with the most clues without another copy attached. Forced - After you end your turn at the attached location: You must take 1 horror or search the bag for a [moon] token and seal it on your investigator card. [action]: Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, discard Hypnotic Glamour.

name: Phantasmal Deception
text: Revelation - Put Phantasmal Deception into play next to the agenda deck. While investigating, each investigator gets -1 skill value for each [moon] token sealed on investigator cards at their location. Forced - After a [moon] token is released: Discard Phantasmal Deception. (Max once per token.)

name: Lunar Influence
text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). This test gets +1 difficulty for each [moon] token sealed on your investigator card. If you fail, discard a card from your hand at random. If you fail by 2 or more, lose an action.

flavor: If only this horrid creature were a werewolf.
name: Mooncalf
text: Hunter. Prey - Investigator with 1 or more [moon] tokens sealed on their investigator card. Mooncalf gets +1 fight and +1 evade for each [moon] token sealed on investigator cards at its location.

flavor:
"I hate the moon â€” I am afraid of it â€” for when it shines on certain scenes familiar and loved it sometimes makes them unfamiliar and hideous."
- H. P. Lovecraft, What the Moon Brings
name: Ominous Moonlight
text: Surge. Revelation - Search the chaos bag for a [moon] token and seal it on your investigator card.

flavor:
It's in an acrobat's nature to seek out
the most dangerous of challenges.
name: New Moon Acrobat
text: Hunter. Forced - If you succeed by 2 or more while attacking New Moon Acrobat, if New Moon Acrobat is ready: It attacks you (before your attack resolves).

name: New Moon Beast Tamer
text: Aloof. Hunter. Forced - When an enemy at New Moon Beast Tamer's location or a connecting location makes an attack, if New Moon Beast Tamer is ready and unengaged: That attack deals +1 damage. If the attacking enemy has the [[Creature]] or [[Monster]] traits, that attack deals +1 horror as well.

flavor:
Raw strength is the only thing that the
strongman won't expect to face him.
name: New Moon Strongman
text: Hunter. Each [combat] icon committed to attacks against New Moon Strongman counts as 2 matching icons instead. (This effect does not double [wild] icons)

flavor:
You've been selected as a volunteer
for this next trick.
name: Reckless Stunt
text: Revelation - Test [agility] (3). This test gets +1 difficulty if there is a [[Performer]] enemy at your location. If you fail, you must take 2 damage or lose 3 resources.

flavor:
The man's mutations seem impossible even
to the most imaginative of spectator.
name: New Moon Carny
text:
Hunter.
While New Moon Carny has exactly 1 damage on it, it gains retaliate and alert.
While New Moon Carny has exactly 2 damage on it, it gets +1 fight and +1 evade.

flavor: "What're you laughin' at?"
name: New Moon Clown
text:
Hunter. Retaliate.
New Moon Clown gets +1 evade for each [moon] token sealed on an investigator card at its location.
[reaction] After you successfully evade New Moon Clown by 2 or more: Heal 1 horror and shuffle New Moon Clown back into the encounter deck.

name: New Moon Magician
text: Aloof. Spawn - Any location without investigators. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase: Search the chaos bag for a [moon] token and seal it on the nearest investigator card to New Moon Magician. While there are no [moon] tokens in the chaos bag, New Moon Magician loses aloof, gains hunter and gets +2 fight.

flavor:
Just keep telling yourself that it's all
sleight of hand.
name: Quicker Than the Eye
text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). This test gets +1 difficulty if there is a [[Performer]] enemy at your location. If you fail, you must take 2 horror or choose and discard 2 cards from your hand.

name: Terrified Captives
text: Revelation - Attach Terrified Captives to any location without an investigator (unrevealed, if possible). The current agenda gets -1 doom threshold. [action] Test [combat] or [agility] (4). This test gets -1 difficulty if you control a [[Tool]] asset. If you succeed, move Terrified Captives to the victory display.

name: Lost All Control
text: Peril. Revelation - Attach Lost All Control to an investigator or [[Ally]] asset controlled by any investigator (with an ability, if possible) without a copy attached. Forced - After you activate or trigger an ability on the attached card: Deal 1 direct damage or 1 direct horror to that card. [reaction] After a [moon] token is released from a card at your location: Discard Lost All Control.

name: Wild Hysteria
text: Revelation - Attach Wild Hysteria to your location. As an additional cost to enter, leave, or investigate the attached location, spend 1 action. [action]: Parley. Test any skill (3). This test gets +1 difficulty for each [moon] token sealed on an investigator card at your location. If you succeed, discard Wild Hysteria.

name: Primordial Evils
text: Peril. Revelation - You must (choose one): - Attach Primordial Evils to the scenario reference card. Reduce the modifier of each [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], and [moon] token by 1. (ex -2 becomes -3) - Place 1 doom on the current agenda. This effect can cause the current agenda to advance.

name: Dense Tangle
text: Revelation - Put Dense Tangle into play next to the agenda deck. Forced - After you move to a location that is not the leftmost connection symbol printed on your previous location: Lose 1 action. Forced - At the end of the round, discard one copy of Dense Tangle. (Max once per round.)

name: Lost the Trail
text: Revelation - If there is no copy of Lost the Trail in your threat area, put it into play in your threat area. Otherwise it gains surge. As an additional cost to move from your location, reveal a random chaos token. If you reveal a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], [auto_fail], or [moon] token, instead move to a different connecting location. [action] [action]: Discard Lost the Trail. If your location's shroud value is 2 or less, reduce this ability's cost by 1 action.

name: Curse of the Rougarou - Circus Ex Mortis Changes
text:
During this scenario, [moon] tokens gain beneficial effects in addition to their normal effects. The following three abilities are active during the scenario:
[fast] During a test at your location, release a [moon] token from a card you control: Reduce the difficulty of that test by 2. (Group limit once per test.)
[reaction] When an investigator at your location would take damage and/or horror from a [[Monster]] enemy's attack, release a [moon] token from a card you control: Cancel up to 2 damage, 2 horror, or any combination thereof. (Group limit once per attack.)
[reaction] When an investigator at your location would deal 1 or more damage to a non-[[Elite]] enemy, release a [moon] token from a card you control: Deal 1 additional damage to that enemy. (Group limit once per instance.)
